title: help aux philippines super typhon odette
Description: Bonjour à tousPour ceux qui me connaissent vous savez que j'attache beaucoup d'importance à l'archipel des philippines et à sa population qui en cette fin d'année à été touchés par un SUPER THYPHON (odette), surtout palawan une des plus belle îles du monde où j'ai vécu plus d'un ans et créé beaucoup de lien avec les locaux qui sont d'une gentillesse et d'un accueil incroyable, je n'ai pas pour habitude de demander un don mais vu l'ampleur des dégâts causé par ce super thypon je me suis permis de créer une cagnotte spécialement pour eux, beaucoup de locaux n'ont plus de toit, plus d'eau, plus d'électricité et dorment dehors.....si quelques un d'entre vous ferais un petit geste même de 1 ou 2 euros (ou plus si vous le souhaitez) qui représente pas grand chose pour certains d'entre-nous mais énormément pour eux cela permettrait de les aider un minimum pour acheter de l'eau, de la nouriture et un minimum de maison réparer......j'ai plus de 3500 amis sur Facebook si chacun mettais 1 euros la cagnotte serai atteinte.Je remercie par avance ceux qui participeront à donner un peu d'espoir à cette gentil population.Hello everyoneFor those who know me you know that I attach a lot of importance to the archipelago of the Philippines and its population which at the end of the year has been affected by a SUPER THYPHON (odette), especially Palawan one of the most beautiful islands of the world where I lived for more than a year and created a lot of bond with the locals who are incredibly kind and welcoming, I don't usually ask for a donation but given the scale of the damage caused by this super thypon I allowed myself to create a kitty especially for them, many locals no longer have a roof, no more water, no more electricity and are sleeping outside ..... if a few between you would make a small gesture even of 1 or 2 euros (or more if you wish it) which represents not much for some of us but enormously for them that would allow to help them a minimum, I have more than 3500 friends on Facebook if each one put 1 euro the pot will be reached.I thank in advance those who will participate in giving a little hope to this nice population.Read more

title: typhon raiodette soutien siargao island
Description: SOLIDARITE! Le typhon Rai/Odette de catégorie 5 (maximale) a touché les Philippines jeudi dernier (16/12/21).Plus de 400 000 personnes ont du fuir leur domicile. Le bilan humain est encore incertain. Les dégâts sont importants, certaines régions ont été rasées.Les habitants se retrouvent dans des conditions préoccupantes, ils n'ont plus d'eau potable, plus d'électricité, plus de nourriture, de toits... Alors que la population connaît déjà une grande précarité, accentuée par la crise covid.Les Philippines sont extrêmement vulnérables aux catastrophes naturelles, les typhons sont de plus en plus violents, à mesure que le changement climatique provoqué par l’homme s’accélère. Chaque année une vingtaine de typhons détruisent des habitations, les récoltes et les infrastructures.Plusieurs îles ont été touchées par cette dernière catastrophe, Surigao, Dinagat, Leyte, Bohol, Cebu, Negros, Palawan... Siargao est l'une d'elles et, parce qu'elle est située dans le Pacifique, elle a été frappée de plein fouet. C'est une île sur laquelle il y a peu de temps j'ai rencontré des personnes très précieuses à mes yeux et à mon coeur. Aujourd'hui ces amis philippins s'entraident et se mobilisent sur place pour aider les plus démunis. Dans l'urgence ils viennent de rassembler, d'acheminer et de distribuer de l'eau et de la nourriture mais cela n'est suffisant que pour quelques jours. Ils ont besoin de quoi reconstruire leurs maisons, dégager les arbres tombés, les débris, les ruines et les routes, de quoi filtrer l'eau, s'éclairer (il faudra au moins 6 mois avant de pouvoir de nouveau avoir de l'électricité), il leur faut des outils, des médicaments (contre la déshydratation et la diarrhée notamment), et plus de riz.Les philippins sont à mes yeux un modèle en terme de générosité, de solidarité et de résilience. Si vous souhaitez les soutenir, vous pouvez participer à cette cagnotte. Chaque don est versé aux locaux, présents sur le terrain.Soyons nous aussi solidaires et ne nous mettons pas des œillères sur ce qui se passe autour de nous, que ça soit à l'autre bout du monde ou proche de chez nous. J'encourage tout le monde à faire quelque chose, ce qu'il peut, pour cette cause là, ou pour une autre.A ceux qui ont lu ce post en entier merci beaucoup! Vous pouvez aussi le partager (si vous le voulez). Salamat karajaw!Read more

title: christmas devastation of super typhoon odette
Description: Juste une semaine avant Noel, les conséquences de ce super typhon dévastateur Odette ont laissé beaucoup de nos compatriotes philippins avec des maisons brisées et des toits arrachés, ne laissant aucun abri à l'intérieur de leur maison. Beaucoup ont des enfants qui ramassent des morceaux de leur maison au lieu de pouvoir profiter de la saison de Noel et beaucoup n'ont jamais reçu la visite du Père Noël. Certaines familles ont très peu d'argent mais une énorme fierté. S'il vous plaît, aidez-nous à réparer certaines de leurs maisons comme cadeau de Noël.Just a week before CHRISTMAS the aftermath of this devastating super typhoon Odette has left many of our fellow Filipinos with broken houses and roofs torn off leaving no shelter inside their home. Many have children who are picking up pieces of their homes instead of being able to enjoy the CHRISTMAS season and many have never received a visit from Santa Clause. Some of the families have very little money but a huge amount of Pride. Please help us to repair some of their homes as your Christmas gift.Read more

Our hearts go out to Jesse and his family.We will be putting a list together of items needed for the family and will have a designated drop off day. Once we have more information on that we will share. Read more

title: te shpetojme jeten e aurelit
Description: Të dashur vëllezër dhe motraJeta e përditshme e atyre me më pak fat se ne është një luftë që është e vështirë të imagjinohet nga shume prej nesh. Imagjinoni ndjenjën e deshpermimit të një familjeje pa çati mbi kokë, apo të dikujt që nuk mund të sigurojë ushqim, veshje apo nevoja mjekësore për veten dhe fëmijët e tij. Fatkeqësisht, këto janë shqetësime reale në jetën e shumë bashkatdhetarëve tane shqiptarë për shkak të rrethanave jashtë kontrollit të tyre. Askush nuk dëshiron të jetë në atë pozitë, por fatkeqësisht shumë janë. Misioni ynë është i qarte, tu shërbejme dhe tu ndihmojme sa me shumë vëllezërve dhe motrave tona në nevojë, por misioni ynë nuk do të ishte i mundur pa mbështetjen tuaj. Ju jeni ata qe mund të siguroni një të ardhme të ndritur për jetimët, shpresë për të pafuqishmit e lehtësim për të sëmurët."Permireso një jetë, ndrysho një botë" kjo është filozofia jonë. Vizioni ynë është të fuqizojmë njerëzit dhe t'i aftësojmë ata që të ndihmojnë veten dhe komunitetet e tyre. Le të bashkohemi së bashku e t'i kthejmë lotët e dëshpërimit në lot gëzimi. Ne besojme fort që çdo moment eshte i rëndësishem, sepse cdo dite ka jetë qe ndalojne në pritje te një dore ndihmë.Faleminderit dhe Zoti ju bekoftë ju dhe familjet tuaja!Dear Brothers and SistersThe day-to-day living of those less fortunate than us is a struggle that is hard to imagine in our modernized activities. Imagine the feeling of hopelessness of a family without a roof on their head, or someone unable to provide food, clothing, and medical needs for himself and his kids.Unfortunately, these are real concerns in the lives of many fellow Albanians due to circumstances outside of their control. No one wants to be in that position, but unfortunately many are. Our mission is to serve and help our brothers and sisters in need, but our mission would not be possible without your support. You can ensure a bright future for the orphans, offer hope for the helpless, and provide relief for the sick."Brighten a life, change a world" is our philosophy. Our vision is to empower people and enable them to help themselves and their communities. Let’s get together and turn tears of desperation into tears of joy. We are strong believers that every moment counts because lives are on hold for every day that goes by without a helping hand.Thank you and may God Bless you and your families!Read more

title: support ksar ongoing operations
Description: The Kabul Small Animal Rescue will keep its doors open after our upcoming mammoth evacuation, and will need your continued support to do so. Our mission in Afghanistan is simple: help any animal in need to the best of our ability. This includes pets, stray animals, and working dogs, regardless of owners. Funds will go towards food, medicine, animal transportation, in country staff salaries and benefits (including food and medical aid), facility rentals and upkeep, equipment costs, utilities, and toys. We will stay open for as long as it is safe and we have the means to do so.We will rehome all our rescues outside of the country for the foreseeable future, so the many animals in our care that are too young for this flight or that we haven't had long enough to put on the flight list will be transported, ideally on commercial flights.Every day we get orphaned, sick, injured, or needy animals dropped at our door or called in, and we will respond to the best of our abilities.Please consider a small donation to this fund to support the ongoing operations of KSAR or sharing this with your friends and family.Read more

title: taylors fundraiser for end overdose
Description: Hi. My name is Taylor Wood and I’m turning 25 this weekend on January 16th. For my birthday this year, I want to celebrate by raising money for a nonprofit called End Overdose. End Overdose is dedicated to ending the fight against fentanyl and overdose prevention. This cause is extremely close to my heart. This past year we lost our best friend, Kevin Fisher, to fentanyl poisoning and accidental overdose. Kevin was a once in a lifetime friend. Losing him shattered so many hearts and life will never be the same without him. I know that everyone who knew and loved Kevin is struggling as much as I am.This unfortunately goes beyond Kevin. I know almost everyone right now has lost someone due to fentanyl poisoning or overdose. Fentanyl is killing our friends, brothers, sisters, and loved ones. Too many people have lost their lives to this. Deaths from fentanyl and overdose can be prevented if we all help together. No donation amount is too small and everything is deeply appreciated. Please join me in this fight to help protect the people we love. Let’s stop watching this epidemic unfold from the sidelines and come together to be the change.More information about End Overdose Incorporated: End Overdose is a 501c3 nonprofit committed to preventing drug-related death as a result of overdose through naloxone training in person and online. We provide fentanyl test kits as well. End Overdose gives health equity to all persons in need, our services are completely free. We raise public awareness, connecting communities with the necessary resources to fight chemical dependency and drug overdose death. United, we can End Overdose.Read more

title: lemon was shot medical expenses fundraiser
Description: Last week, we received an urgent request from a shelter for the emergency rescue of Lemon, who had been brought in with a severe leg injury. She was in pain and at risk of infection, and needed immediate veterinary care.We took Lemon to an emergency vet clinic, where she was treated with pain medication and they took X-rays. The X-rays revealed poor little Lemon had been shot; her rear right tibia is shattered, with metal and bone fragments scattered through the soft tissue. The next stop for Lemon was an orthopedic specialist who assessed the damage and made a plan for surgery to save her leg.Lemon was hospitalized for the weekend and is getting surgery today. She was kept quiet and on pain medication to keep her comfortable and antibiotics to prevent infection. After her surgery, she will go into foster care to recover.Lemon is an absolute sweetie who is affectionate with all the humans helping her, despite the pain and trauma she just experienced. We wish she did not have to go through this. At least we can promise her the very best of care and love that will help her heal physically and emotionally.Read more

title: robbery relief for non profit dublin preschool
Description: *I just wanted to add...This gofundme is set up under the school's tax ID, all donations go directly to them! I just set up the account on their behalf!**Funds raised beyond what is needed for replacement costs will go to enhancing the preschool through safety, educational and essential items, and whatever else may be beneficial moving forward. *Two nights ago, local and beloved non-profit Dublin preschool Resurrection Lutheran Child Development was robbed of more than $4,000 worth of items while they were on a week's hiatus because of Covid, including ipads, Amazon Alexas, Fire tablets, cameras, teacher's gift cards, office supplies, food, snacks, diapers, furniture, tools, hardware and more.Not only were they robbed of many many items, the burglars also broke door frames, and vandalized some of the church. They literally stole furniture they couldn't break open. The whole school will also need to be rekeyed and have cameras put in place, in the upwards of $3,500. 00.This preschool has been around for many years, and has made a huge impact for many local Dubliners who's children have gone here. They operate out of a small church and already make far less than large corporate preschools. They also charge much less for their care. It is very apparent when you visit Resurrection Lutheran Child Development that these teachers do what they do out of love. They love and cherish the children that they care for.Please help me in making a difference for the amazing teachers and staff here locally. They are so saddened and devastated by all of this loss and destruction and need our help locally! Any amount will help! Please do something good for your own community during this unprecedented time!The teachers and staff will use the funds donated to replace expenses from vandalism and theft. Donations as soon as possible are greatly appreciated! Much love....Read more

title: help to save the windward zero waste hui
Description: The Windward Zero Waste School Hui is a living system that educates students about sustainability at Ka’ohao, Ka’elepulu, Kainalu and Enchanted Lake Elementary schools as well as Kailua Intermediate School. Using hot compost and green waste piles, worms and cardboard and paper management, the Hui has reduced school trash by over 90%. In fact, 57.8 TONS of waste has been diverted from Oahu landfills in 2021, so far. Check out Zero Waste School Hui for stats on food recovery, composting and vermicomposting. Mindy and the team publish daily!This award-winning, nationally-acclaimed zero waste program, a partnership of Windward Oahu schools working cooperatively in the pursuit of waste reduction, soil restoration, and applied environmental education is at risk of shutting down due to a shortage of funding. Our fundraising goal to sustain the program through the end of the 2021-2022 school year is $50,000, which will be used to support the trained staff members who manage all organic processing daily, and educate the next generation ofenvironmental leaders.Over 2,000 students participate every school day, contributing food waste to composting systems which turn the material into rich, organic compost, which is sold to the community with all income going back to participating schools to fund sustainability and education programs.If you would like to donate, please click the Donate Now button, or the donate button at Zero Waste - Donate : this directs donations to O’ahu Resource Conservation and Development Council.If you have a special set of skills or time you’d like to donate to the program, please contact us.The Windward Zero Waste School Hui initiative is a non-profit program of the Oahu ResourceConservation and Development Council , a 501(c)(3) organization. EIN 94-3279682Read more

title: ksr and kentucky chamber foundation relief fund
Description: So many individuals, businesses, and more here in Kentucky and across the nation are looking for ways to help those impacted by deadly storms that swept through western Kentucky over the weekend, claiming many lives.Kentucky Sports Radio (KSR) and the Kentucky Chamber Foundation are partnering to build a relief fund for our fellow Kentuckians to ensure they are able to rebuild.With the money raised in this fund, our two groups will be working with local communities, local chambers, as well as our state and local elected officials to ensure the needs of these areas are met in the wake of tragedy. The funds will be distributed quickly to those groups to help our fellow Kentuckians rebuild.The Kentucky Chamber Foundation is a 501c3 entity and donations are tax-deductible.Individuals and companies can donate through the portal or contribute by mailing a check to 464 Chenault Rd. Frankfort, KY 40601 with ATTN to the Tornado Relief Fund.Match your donation!Share your donation receipt with your company and ask them if they will match your donation.KSR and the Kentucky Chamber are committed to helping rebuild our communities and we appreciate your help and the overwhelming compassion and generosity of so many.Read more

title: build affordable housing in new orleans
Description: Bethlehem Lutheran Church needs your help now to build ADA-accessible affordable housing in the heart of New Orleans through an innovative partnership with the Tulane University School of Architecture.Our beloved neighbors and unique culture cannot survive without affordable housing. Can you share our Facebook post and then give $20 today to build this house?#BuildAHomeWithBethlehemScroll down for the full story!-Facebook Post- https://www.facebook.com/BethlehemNOLA/posts/2695373577433281-Other ways to give-Checks and Cash can be sent to:Bethlehem Lutheran Church1823 Washington AveNew Orleans, LA 70113EIN# 72-0497929Bethlehem Lutheran Church - Free Meals to Affordable HousingIn January 2022, Bethlehem Lutheran Church, one of the oldest historically Black Lutheran Congregations in the United States, celebrates its 133rd anniversary in New Orleans' Central City neighborhood. Over the last two years, Bethlehem has served over 45,000 gourmet meals to the community through Community Table, a program that serves around 500 free, no-questions-asked meals a week. On this momentous occasion, we are expanding our commitment to serve our neighbors by taking action against the affordable housing crisis in our neighborhood. This Spring, with your help, we will build the first of four new affordable housing units across from the church.The Affordable Housing Crisis in New OrleansOur vibrant Central City neighborhood is currently under assault by housing and rental prices - a crisis only intensified by Hurricane Ida. For example, the Median Household Income of Bethlehem’s 70113 ZIP is $18,446, and in New Orleans you would have to work 113 hours a week at minimum wage to afford a 2bd rental at fair market rent. Meanwhile, the waiting list for affordable housing vouchers in New Orleans is over 20,000 people long. At every meal we serve, we hear terrible stories from our neighbors about illegal evictions, unsafe living conditions, and rent prices that families simply cannot afford.Project ScopeThe first phase of our project will focus on constructing four new affordable rental units over the new four years. Our first house will be 1100 sqft, features a beautiful interior courtyard, and has been designed from the beginning to be ADA-accessible throughout. After we've begun this work by creating affordable housing, the second phase will build a much-needed new santuary for Bethlehem Lutheran Church to allow us to expand our kitchen and provide space to serve our neighborhood in new ways.Partner - Tulane University School of ArchitectureTo build these townhouses, Bethlehem Lutheran Church is partnering with URBANbuild, an award-winning program at the Tulane University School of Architecture. In this program students design a house each fall and build it in the spring. One of the innovative aspects of this partnership has been the collaboration between Bethlehem and the Architecture students throughout the design process. Another is that the School of Architecture is donating the design and labor for this project, allowing us to construct the first townhouse, clear the lot of concrete, and do all necessary permiting for $225,000.Partner - CrescentCareAs each unit of housing is completed, we will partner with CrescentCare, one of New Orleans' most respected community health organizations, to provide housing and supportive care to community members. CrescentCare provides high quality and culturally humble care to the entire New Orleans community. They are particularly focused on our Greater New Orleans neighbors who come from traditionally medically underserved communities: the service industry, the LGBTQ community, the uninsured and the underinsured, immigrants, and communities of color.Groundbreaking This Week!The groundbreaking ceremony for this project is Sunday, January 9th at 12pm. We would love for you to join us if you're in town!Because this project is already underway, it is imperative that we raise this money by Mardi Gras Day (March 1st). With your help, we will open our first unit of affordable housing this June!Recognition:Institutions that give at least $5,000 and Individuals/Familiesthat give at least $1,000 will receive special recognition on site.Everyone who contributes will be invited in-person or virtually to our dedication party (with special musical guests) once the house is completed!Our Ask:Please join us and give what you can as we work together to reach our initial $50k fundraising goal. This will pay for the lumber, exterior walls, exterior doors, and exterior windows for this house! Rendering of the houseWe will be building four houses over the next four yearsWe Never Stop Serving our Community  The Future Site Being Cleared this December We served over 9000 meals in the 18 days after Hurricane Ida this fallCheck out this beautiful version of "Blessed Assurance" from worship at Bethlehem We're a small congregation that focuses everything we've got on feeding our neighbors. Now with your help, we will work to house them too!Read more

title: please save damian
Description: MY BABY IS DYING, PLEASE HELP!Everyone who meets Damian is instantly smitten with him. My 2-year-old is truly an angel on earth – sweet, smiley, social, and has recently started cupping his cheeks with his hands to form the cutest smile you’ve ever seen!Damian was also recently diagnosed with a devastatingly fatal disease called Acid Sphingomyelinase Deficiency (ASMD), also referred to as Niemann-Pick Disease Types A & B (NPA & NPB). Damian’s case appears to be a mild form of Type A, the most severe form of the disease, which is characterized by an early onset (infancy) of progressive systemic manifestations such as:· an enlarged liver and spleen· loss of muscle tone· failure to thrive· rapid neurodegeneration (think baby Alzheimer’s) that leads to death typically by 3 years of age Since Damian’s case is mild, he has a greater chance of living past 3 years old. However, any neurological damage that Damian incurs likely can’t be reversed, and if nothing is done to stop or slow the progression of his disease, he will likely die before his 5th birthday.WE NEED YOUR HELP TO SAVE DAMIANTwo potentially promising treatments are on the horizon, but funding is desperately needed to speed up the timeline and clear the pathway to a clinical trial. With your help, collectively we have a chance to save Damian’s life.Please, help me save my precious boy. Please #SaveDamian. Whether or not you are able to donate, please spread the word and share this campaign with others. Thank you, thank you, thank you. <3Love,Brittany (Damian's Mom) and Brock (Damian’s Dad)HOW YOU CAN HELP TODAY1. Donate what you can, no amount too small (donations are tax deductible)2. Share on all social media with the hashtag #SaveDamian3. Email our GoFundMe and these steps to all contacts4. Leverage any avenue you have to make this go viral (or send me leads/tips)!- TIP! - DOUBLE YOUR DONATIONMany employers are set up to match contributions their employees make to any 501(c)3 non-profit charity, so please check with your HR manager as it could double your donation!WHERE THE MONEY IS GOINGAll contributions are tax deductible and go to the Wylder Nation Foundation, a 501(c)3 non-profit organization (Tax ID: 46-2849095) who has been funding this research that can give Damian a shot at life. 100% of the funds raised here will go directly to fast-tracking this research and what is needed to initiate a clinical trial. The research includes a unique small molecule that passes the blood brain barrier (BBB) and has demonstrated remarkable results at potentially slowing or stopping the rapid course of neurodegeneration that happens in NPA. Additional research is surrounding a gene therapy that has the potential to replace the defective gene responsible for Damian’s disease with a functioning working copy of the gene for a more permanent treatment.THERE IS A CLEAR PATH TO TREATMENT1. Manufacture clinical grade drug production2. Final safety studies3. Get FDA approval to proceed with clinical drug4. Start clinical trialIf you would like to donate by check, please make the check out to:Wylder Nation Foundation (in memo write #SaveDamian)Send To:Wylder Nation Foundation8924 E. Pinnacle Peak RdSte. G5-574Scottsdale, AZ 85255Read more

title: kdakiliclimb2022
Description: To promote the gift of life through living donation, 22 kidney donors will represent Kidney Donor Athletes (KDA) with a summit of Mt Kilimanjaro on World Kidney Day (March 10, 2022). KDA is using this climb to bring awareness to living donation, demonstrate what is possible post-donation, and to launch initiatives which inspire, support and educate people about the experience of living donation. We envision a world where there are enough living donors to meet the needs of all who require a life saving kidney transplant.Learn more about who we are at: https://kidneydonorathlete.org/DONORS: If you are donating in support of a particular climber, please select that climber's name from the "Referred by" dropdown when you process your contribution. Thank you for supporting this important cause!Read more

title: amhara emergency fund
Description: አማራን እንደ ህዝብ ኢትዮጵያን እንደ ሃገር የማስቀጠል/የማዳን እና ለወገን ደጀን የመሆን ጥሪ!አማራው በዜግነቱ እንደማንኛውም ኢትዮጵያዊ በሚኖርባቸው የአገሪቱ ማዕዘናት በፖለቲካዊ እቅድ ተለይቶ ሲገደል፣ ሲፈናቀልና ሲሳደድ ለከፋ ማኅበራዊና ኢኮኖሚያዊ ቀውስ ተዳርጎ በችግር ሲማቅቅ በርካታ ዐሠርት አመታትን አሳልፏል። ይህ አንሶት ዛሬ "የለውጥ ዘመን" በሚባለው ጊዜ ከነዘር ምንዝሩ እየተጨፈጨፈ፣ የተገኘባቸው ቀዬዎችና ከተሞች እየወደሙ፣ በነፍስ የተረፈው በመቶ ሺዎች የሚቆጠር ህዝብ በአገሩ ስደተኛ ሆኖ አለበቂ መጠለያ የእለት ጉርስ ተመጽዋች ሆኖ ይገኛል።ይባስ ብሎ ትህነግ "ከአማራ ጋር ሂሳብ አወራርዳለሁ" ብሎ በከፈተብን ጦርነት እነሆ አገር መጋቢው የአማራ ገበሬ ማሳ በማለስለሻውና በመዝሪያው ወቅት፣ በሐምሌ፣ ትህነግ ጦርነት በከፈተባቸው ግንባሮች ሁሉ ህልውናውን ለማስከበር በመዋደቅ ላይ ይገኛል ። ይህ ጦርነት የአማራው ብቻ ሳይሆን የመላ አገሪቱ የህልውና ስጋት ነው። ይህን በችግር ኖሮ አገር ደግፎ ያኖረ ህዝብ በዚህ ክፉ ቀን መደገፍ ኢትዮጵያን ማዳን መሆኑን ማንም አገሩን የሚወድ አይስተውም። በዚህ እምነት በአሜሪካ፤ በካናዳ፤ በአውሮፓ በአውስትራሊያ ፤ ኒውዚ ላንድ እንዲሁም አፍሪካ እና እስያ ያሉ የአማራ ማህበራት ከወንፈል ጋር በመተባበር ለወገናችን የምግብ እና የህክምና እርዳታ የሚውል የገንዘብ ማሰባሰቢያ መርሀ ግብር አዘጋጅተናል። በዚህም ሆነ በሌሎች ተመሳሳይ የእርዳታ ማሰባሰቢያ አጋርነታችሁን ላሳያችሁ እርዳታው በታቀደለት ወገናችን ስም ከፍ ያለ ምስጋና ይድረሳችሁ። የመርሀ ግብሩን ሂደት በየጊዜው በኢሜይልና በዚህ ገጽ እናሳውቃለን።ከዚህ ገንዘብ ማሰባሰቢያ ውጭ የሚደረጉ እንደ ቴሌቶን ያሉ መርሐ ግብሮች እያዘጋጀን እናስ ታውቃለን።የሚከተሉትን አማራጭ የገንዘብ መለገሻ መንገዶች ሊጠቀሙ ይችላሉ:: Please include “Amhara Emergency Fund” in the comment section1. Wonfel Paypal Giving Acct: paypal.com/us/fundraiser/charity/35584282. For Venmo and Zelle please use the Wonfel email: info'@‘wonfel.org*************For the last three years, Amharas were under consistent attack and people have been suffering. Millions have been displaced, thousands wounded and hundreds of children orphaned. The current conflict in northern Ethiopia is worsening the situation specifically after TPLF declared an all out war on Amhara. It is high time for us Ethiopians to stand together and look after one another. Let’s act collectively and contain our brothers and sisters’ suffering before it spreads to the rest of our country. Your donations will go a great length to provide emergency food, medical supplies and shelter. If not NOW, when? If not US, who will stand for our people?**********************Partcipating OrganizationsFederation of Amharas in North America (FANA)Amhara Association of America - [email redacted]     Amhara Professionals Union - [email redacted]Amhara Association of Colorado - [email redacted]Amhara People’s Civic Organization (Dallas) - [email redacted]Amhara Association in Georgia - [email redacted]Amhara Association in Seattle - [email redacted]Amhara Association of California - [email redacted]Amhara Association of Los Angeles - [email redacted]Amhara Association of Nevada - [email redacted]Amhara Heritage Society of Minnesota - [email redacted]Canadian Amhara Societies Alliance (CASA) – [email redacted]International Amhara Alliance (IAA) – [email redacted]Amhara Support, Relief & Rehabilitation Association (ASRRA) - New Zealand – [email redacted]Yotor Farmers' Association [email redacted]International Amhara Union [email redacted]Amhara Association of NorwayWonfel Aid [email redacted]Interviewshttps://youtu.be/U6KrypquaDohttps://youtu.be/Osqu1MBH9MYhttps://youtu.be/5gZE3PnFqd0https://youtu.be/LTILl-HTZzwhttps://youtu.be/qYDOtU_2dq8https://youtu.be/Tx29iBwQeaAhttps://youtu.be/U6KrypquaDohttps://youtu.be/jCzv9G6uDbUhttps://youtu.be/S5O6K9q6guYRead more

title: 4f5p7z emergency surgery for baby
Description: *This post contains images graphic in nature. Please proceed with caution.*Wednesday, January 12th Salisbury City Animal Control and Wicomico County Animal Control responded to a call of dogs in an outdoor kennel making sounds the complainant had never heard before.Upon arrival to the address, WCAC observed two dogs locked in a crate and one had been attacked. The owner of the dogs was on the property and cooperated with involved agencies.The victim dog, named Baby, is currently in critical condition in our facility under the care of the Humane Society of Wicomico County's Shelter Veterinarian Dr. Jennifer Mahan and Vet Tech Hannah Peck. She has multiple puncture wounds and severe damage to her right front leg. Her wounds are severe but we are hopeful. If she is stabilized, she will need surgery to amputate her leg. If and when the time comes, she will be put up for adoption.WCAC returned to the address with Wicomico County Sheriff's Department to investigate this incident. Both dogs are small unaltered females locked together in a small space. One was in heat which we believed caused the aggression. This was a terrible accident caused by negligence.The second dog will be held in our custody for the duration of her 10 day bite quarantine. We have no further information at this time.Any donation toward Baby's medical care will be graciously appreciated.More information about the Humane Society of Wicomico County can be found at www.wicomicohumane.org. Questions can be directed to Megan Koester via email.Read more

title: help princess elsa
Description: Princess Elsa is in need of extended medical payments.  She came to us "Frozen" and is currently a patient at WellPet Animal Hospital in Lexington, Va.   She was matted to the point that she couldn't walk or care for herself. She had been so long without food that it is effecting liver functions.  Her kidneys are good but we've since found out from the vets that her liver is not functioning. They are giving her fluids and food supplements as well as appetite stimulants .   She had a chipped bone in her rear hip area that messed up a disk in her back cause paralysis in her leg.  The vet thinks that there was no trauma but that she jumped down from somewhere and because of her matted fur could not land properly.  WE expect and are praying for a good recovery but she will be at the animal hospital and in medical care for a long time.  She did try to sit up and sun herself but was too weak.   We need your help to pay for Elsa's medical bills.  We are a small non-profit organization that is not equipped to handle this kind of expense.  Please give here what ever you can.  Thank you.  Furever Friends Lodge-Buena Vista, VA.Read more

title: paulas ride for ovarian cancer
Description: My name is Sydney, my mother Paula passed away from ovarian cancer on January 3rd, 2020. Ovarian cancer is the most fatal women's cancer and receives minimal government funding. Breast cancer receives $249.3 million in federal funding while ovarian cancer receives $38.6 million (Ovarian Cancer Canada, 2017). An estimated 3,000 Canadian women will be diagnosed with ovarian cancer, and 1,950 will die from it (Canadian Cancer Society, 2020). I wanted to raise money to donate in my mothers name. Paula was battling cancer since 2009, it was something she intended to beat, but unfortunately, her second diagnosis was fatal. In Paula's name, we will help other women successfully battle ovarian cancer.My dear friends Bronwyn and Olivia are hosting a spin class on January 8th to raise money for ovarian cancer in Paulas name. Although we are keeping it small because of covid-19, we appreciate all the love and support.Read more

title: f45 colorado marshall fire community relief
Description: Please join the F45 Family in support of the communities in Boulder County have been devastated by the Marshall Fire, which has destroyed more than 500 homes in Superior, Louisville, and nearby areas. More than 30,000 people were evacuated from their homes. Our neighbors will need both short-term and long-term assistance. Community Foundation Boulder County is a trusted partner with a long track record of meeting the community's needs in times of crisis. The Boulder County Wildfire Fund will support the immediate needs of Coloradans impacted by the fires and provide the support needed in the months and years to come.Money raised from this fundraiser go directly to the Community Foundation of Boulder County. Read more

title: kn95s for flynn elementary
Description: Want to help out our community? Leonard Flynn Elementary PTA is raising money to provide ten KN95/KF94 masks to EVERY student in the building to keep them and their families safe while schools remain open through the omicron phase of the pandemic. The spike is...spiking!! So we need to act TODAY!Masks are extremely effective at preventing the spread of this rapidly skyrocketing illness, and according to medical experts and the CDC, the cloth or poorly-fitting surgical ones just aren't enough to protect against this new variant. Better masks on more kids mean fewer cases, fewer close contacts, more time spent in school, and a safer environment for even our highest-risk kids and families.Approximately $8,000 will provide 10 masks for every student in the building. Any funds we raise beyond that will go to cover additional covid protections for Flynn, such as more KN95/KF94 masks for teachers, rapid tests, or the wellness fund, or to purchase masks for another SFUSD elementary with a smaller PTA.You can also help by donating any extra new, unused N95, KN95, or KF94 child or adult masks you may already have at home. Just give them to school staff at drop-off or pick-up, or bring them to the next PTA Coffee Chat.Flynn is a community-based TK-5 elementary school located in the Mission district and bordering Bernal Heights. At Flynn, all students, regardless of who they are, where they come from, or what their needs may be, have access to a high-level, quality education. But they don't all have great masks! Let's work together to keep everyone safe. Thank you!---¿Quieres ayudar a nuestra comunidad? La PTA de Leonard Flynn Elementary está recaudando dinero para proporcionar diez máscaras KN95/KF94 a CADA estudiante en el edificio para mantenerlos seguros a ellos y a sus familias mientras las escuelas permanecen abiertas durante la fase de omicron de la pandemia. ¡¡El pincho está... pinchando!! ¡Así que tenemos que actuar rápido!Las máscaras son extremadamente efectivas para prevenir la propagación de esta enfermedad que se dispara rápidamente y, según los expertos médicos y los CDC, las máscaras de tela o las quirúrgicas que no se ajustan bien no son suficientes para proteger contra esta nueva variante. Mejores máscaras en más niños significan menos casos, menos contactos cercanos, más tiempo en la escuela y un entorno más seguro incluso para nuestros niños y familias de mayor riesgo.Aproximadamente $8,000 proporcionarán 10 máscaras para cada estudiante en el edificio. Cualquier fondo que recaudemos más allá de eso se destinará a cubrir protecciones covid adicionales para Flynn, como más máscaras KN95/KF94 para maestros, pruebas rápidas, o el fondo de bienestar o para comprar máscaras para otra escuela primaria del SFUSD con una PTA más pequeña.También puede ayudar donando cualquier mascarilla extra nueva, sin usar, para niños o adultos N95, KN95 o KF94 que ya tenga en casa. Solo entrégueselos al personal de la escuela al dejarlos o recogerlos, o llévelos a la próxima charla de café de la PTA.Flynn es una escuela primaria TK-5 basada en la comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Mission y limita con Bernal Heights. En Flynn, todos los estudiantes, independientemente de quiénes sean, de dónde vengan o cuáles sean sus necesidades, tienen acceso a una educación de calidad y alto nivel. ¡Pero no todos tienen grandes máscaras! Trabajemos juntos para mantener a todos a salvo. ¡Gracias!Read more

title: te shpetojme jeten e ajanit nga kosova
Description: Të dashur vëllezër dhe motraJeta e përditshme e atyre me më pak fat se ne është një luftë që është e vështirë të kuptohet nga shume prej nesh. Imagjinoni ndjenjën e deshpermimit të një familjeje pa çati mbi kokë, apo të dikujt që nuk mund të sigurojë ushqim, veshje apo nevoja mjekësore për veten dhe fëmijët e tij. Fatkeqësisht, këto janë shqetësime reale në jetën e shumë bashkatdhetarëve tane shqiptarë për shkak të rrethanave jashtë kontrollit të tyre. Askush nuk dëshiron të jetë në atë pozitë, por fatkeqësisht shumë janë. Misioni ynë është i qarte, tu shërbejme dhe tu ndihmojme sa me shumë vëllezërve dhe motrave tona në nevojë, por misioni ynë nuk do të ishte i mundur pa mbështetjen tuaj. Ju jeni ata qe mund të siguroni një të ardhme të ndritur për jetimët, shpresë për të pafuqishmit e lehtësim për të sëmurët."Permireso një jetë, ndrysho një botë" kjo është filozofia jonë. Vizioni ynë është të fuqizojmë njerëzit dhe t'i aftësojmë ata që të ndihmojnë veten dhe komunitetet e tyre. Le të bashkohemi së bashku e t'i kthejmë lotët e dëshpërimit në lot gëzimi. Ne besojme fort që çdo moment eshte i rëndësishem, sepse cdo dite ka jetë qe ndalojne në pritje te një dore ndihmë.Faleminderit dhe Zoti ju bekoftë ju dhe familjet tuaja!Dear Brothers and SistersThe day-to-day living of those less fortunate than us is a struggle that is hard to imagine in our modernized activities. Imagine the feeling of hopelessness of a family without a roof on their head, or someone unable to provide food, clothing, and medical needs for himself and his kids.Unfortunately, these are real concerns in the lives of many fellow Albanians due to circumstances outside of their control. No one wants to be in that position, but unfortunately many are. Our mission is to serve and help our brothers and sisters in need, but our mission would not be possible without your support. You can ensure a bright future for the orphans, offer hope for the helpless, and provide relief for the sick."Brighten a life, change a world" is our philosophy. Our vision is to empower people and enable them to help themselves and their communities. Let’s get together and turn tears of desperation into tears of joy. We are strong believers that every moment counts because lives are on hold for every day that goes by without a helping hand.Thank you and may God Bless you and your families!Read more

title: walk in memory of ricky
Description: 5 km Walk - Sunday 16th of January 12:00 - 16:00 New Inns, Lavey - in aid of Ballyjamesduff Cancer Support Fund Registered Charity Number 20204681Please come join us for a 5k walk, run or just a cup of tea as we remember Ricky and try to raise some money for a very deserving cause.Ballyjamesduff Cancer Support Group provided an exceptional service to our family in a time of need. This is one of many local cancer support groups throughout the country who do their best to make all our lives a little easier and less stressful as we collectively fight this terrible illness. As a result of fundraising events such as ours, this fantastic charity has now expanded its reach to be able to provide its transportation services in additional areas around Ballyjamesduff including Lavey and Kilnaleck.Your donations, no matter how small, are greatly appreciated.Many ThanksThe WalshesRead more

title: empower bagly 2022
Description: PERFECTLY YOU ‘22Let’s uplift 2022! To kick off this year, our Atlas team is raising money to benefit BAGLY, the Boston Alliance of Gay, Lesbian and Transgender Youth. Please join us in supporting a generation of young leaders—any donation will make an impact.BAGLY is a “youth-led, adult-supported social support organization, committed to social justice and creating, sustaining, and advocating for programs, policies, and services for the LGBTQ+ youth community.” Your support will help BAGLY’s programming and renovations, creating a safe space for queer youth to be healthy, empowered and stronger through community.  Please join us in supporting this community of leaders today.Read more

title: 5 betty white challenge country companion res
Description: We are looking for just 200 Betty White or Golden Girl Fans to honour her legacy and donate just $5 to your local animal rescue – Country Companion. title: SCAR new rescue van
Description: Thank you for visiting Sean Casey Animal Rescue's fundraising page to purchase a new rescue van. Our current van, a 2005 GMC, has enabled us to rescue thousands of animals for well over a decade racking up almost half a million miles! It's a crucial part of our operations. From routine spay/neuter surgeries to life-saving critical care and through crisis response during trying times like Hurricane Sandy and the Covid pandemic this van was a lifeline!We’ve done our best to keep it going with routine maintenance like tune-ups and oil changes and general repairs but age is catching up with it. Repairing the heating and air conditioning systems has become routine. These repairs are costly and are draining our budget. The built-in cages are also in rough shape from daily use and cleaning over the years. Please help us reach our goal of $60,000 to purchase a new rescue transport van, no donation is too small, every donation makes a difference. Please share and help spread the word! Thank you for your continued support!SEAN CASEY ANIMAL RESCUE IS A 501(c)(3) NON-PROFIT, NO-KILL SHELTER specializing in the rescue, rehabilitation and placement of dogs, cats, reptiles, birds and small mammals. Our rescue takes in over 2,000 animals per year, the most of any other private rescue in New York. We are one of very few rescues who take in the most difficult medical cases. We do it because they need life-saving medical care and they have nowhere else to go. Everyone deserves a second chance and our most vulnerable animals need us the most.*Proudly Serving New York City’s Homeless Animals since 1998*153 East 3rd Street, Brooklyn, NY 11218www.nyanimalrescue.orgRead more

title: tommys team 2022
Description: Tommy's Team is heading back to Miami in February 2022 to run the Miami Tropical 5k in Thomas's memory. Along the way, we will once again be raising funds for the Phillip and Patricia Frost Museum of Science in his memory. This year, money will go to Frost's Community Access Fund, which allows Title 1 schools, non-profit organizations, and members of underserved communities to visit the museum free of charge or at discounted rates.Thomas's love of animals and the ocean undoubtedly came from all of our visits to the Miami Seaquarium, Parrot Jungle, the Boston and Baltimore aquariums, and countless other zoos, museums, and aquariums as kids. Our parents instilled in us an appreciation for animals, nature, and science, and I know he would love that we are helping to afford others the same opportunities.To date, with your help, Tommy's Team has raised more than $20,000 for Frost's ocean conservation efforts, summer camps, and animal care throughout the pandemic. We hope you will join us again this year in supporting Frost and celebrating Thomas's life.Learn more here: https://www.frostscience.org/Read more

title: tokitae
Description: This is a critical time for Tokitae: the USDA recently released a report outlining the dire conditions under which she is kept at Miami Seaquarium. Also, it was recently announced that the Dolphin Company is in the process of buying the Seaquarium. This is a time of crisis and also opportunity.If we can show the USDA, other government agencies, and the Dolphin Company, that we have a great home for her in the Salish Sea, as well as a robust plan for her ongoing care, they may see the wisdom and beauty of saying "Yes!" to our call for her release.Please help us secure her Salish Sea home now!Sk'aliCh'elh-tenaut , the orca also known as Tokitae or Lolita, was violently taken from her Salish Sea family over 50 years ago and was sold to the Miami Seaquarium, where she has been performing ever since.She, like other Southern Resident orcas, is a sacred relation of the Lhaq'temish people of Lummi Nation, in northwest Washington State. Sk'aliCh'elh-tenaut is a true Salish Sea daughter, a beloved family member of both her L-pod and the Lhaq'temish people.Orcas are tremendously intelligent, social beings who dive deep and swim for miles every day. For an orca to be isolated in a small concrete tank is a cruelty. For a child to be separated from her family is a tragedy.Lummi tribal members have invoked their kinship, legal, and cultural claims to Sk'aliCh'elh-tenaut and are calling for her to come home. The Lhaq'temish-led non-profit Sacred Sea has spearheaded a campaign to return Sk'aliCh'elh-tenaut to the Salish Sea, where she will be cared for in a custom-built netted area in her native waters.We are working and fundraising in phases:Phase 1: completed. We commissioned Whale Sanctuary Project and their network of experts to draft a comprehensive plan on how to safely and responsibly bring Sk'aliCh'elh-tenaut home. The plan, which was paid for by online donations from our generous supporters, details all aspects of her return, her Salish Sea home, and her ongoing care.Phase 2: NOW. We are fundraising to secure a site for Sk'aliCh'elh-tenaut's home in the Salish Sea. We are in search of a safe, protected area in the San Juan Islands. In this phase of work, we will assess prospective sites and then secure the best available site. Leases, permits, negotiations and outreach are part of this process. We are hopeful that The Dolphin Company (the new owners of Miami Seaquarium) and involved governmental agencies will see that there is a real, better, and immediately actionable alternative to her concrete tank.Phase 3: 2022. Once we have secured a site, we will begin accepting pledges for putting the entire plan into action. If and when she is released from the Seaquarium, those pledges will be called in and she will come home.We are working with and supported by a number of tribal leaders and sister tribes, international Indigenous groups, faith and environmental organizations, and individuals from around the world who have been moved by Sk'aliCh'elh-tenaut's story. Our legal representation is Earth Law Center. Our supporters have made our legal, logistical, and outreach work to date possible.We have faith that Sk'aliCh'elh-tenaut will come home, that an old wrong will be righted, that her orca family will be made whole again, and that this healing will be part of the greater healing that needs to happen between our species and our Mother Earth.Your donation of any amount is greatly appreciated. It will take all of us, Netse Mot (of one heart and one mind), working together to bring her home. Hy'shqe (thank you) for your support!Sacred Lands Conservancy 501c3 doing business as Sacred Sea is a Lhaq'temish-led non-profit committed to Indigenous and indigenized stewardship of the Salish Sea. Learn how we can all be in better relationship with the place we call home at www.SacredSea.org.Read more

title: dr kenneth oconnor scholarship fund
Description: Donations to this fund will establish a scholarship to honor the life of Dr. Kenneth O’Connor, who was a professor of chemistry at Marshall University. Dr. O’Connor generously shared his love of science and chemistry with his students at Marshall and with the greater Huntington-Charleston community through his efforts in chemistry magic shows and scout merit badge workshops. Dr. O’Connor was known for his varied collection of chemical demonstrations, which intrigued and inspired many to pursue careers in science and medicine. He regularly donated an enormous amount of his personal time to meet one-on-one with his students in class or with those who wanted career advice in preparation for medical school. Dr. O’Connor was a greatly respected professor, colleague, and friend who possessed a unique ability to make organic chemistry unintimidating and fun. We seek to remember and continue his great legacy through the establishment of this scholarship fund.Read more

title: stay cool swim cold for unison benevolent fund
Description: Through the month of December – 31 days straight – I’m going to be taking the icy plunge at various cold water locations across Prince Edward Island #offseason I’m doing this both to raise awareness for mental health and the various ways that we can all look after ourselves and to raise a bit of money for the Unison Benevolent Fund!For those of you that don’t know about Unison, it’s a non-profit organization that helps out musicians in any form of need, whether it be financial stress or mental health issues. It’s a great organization and one that is desperately needed as artists from coast to coast to coast struggle to make ends meet.And for those who don’t know me, I’m eight years sober this December, and still working on ways to keep my heart and mind clear. title: senior guardsmen summit aconcagua for scholorship
Description: Beginning Saturday, January 15, 2022...Senior Guardsmen members, Alden Mills, Brett Bush and Chip Pyfer will embark on a 21-day Aconguaga (tallest mountain in South America, 22,838 ft) climbing expedition in Argentina to create awareness for The Guardsmen whose mission is to provide educational opportunities for at-risk Bay Area kids, and raising funds to support The Guardsmen Scholarship Endowment Fund.A few words from Alden, Brett and Chip:Hello friends, family members and fans of The Guardsmen!We’ve delayed this climb for 2 years and we’ve had enough of being cooped up during COVID and thought now was the perfect time to attempt our 4th of the Seven Summits. The pandemic has had an impact on all of us, but none have had it harder than the at-risk youth of the Bay Area.The Guardsmen need our help.They are working overtime to meet the fundraising goals to fund over 250 elementary through high school scholarships. As you might imagine the last two years have been challenging times for fundraising and school, especially for underprivileged kids! If there were ever a time to help The Guardsmen: NOW IS THE TIME!We hope you will step up with us as we take a few hundred thousand steps to attempt to put a Guardsmen flag on our highest peak yet. As was the case with Denali back in 2018, all donations go will benefit The Guardsmen scholarship program! (BTW, we raised over 26k for the kids hiking Denali, we’re looking to beat it this year with 2,525 more feet of elevation as inspiration!)We are all so grateful for your support and please know your support fuels us to keep climbing for the kids!Join us on this expedition and let’s make it an epic start to 2022!!!Yours in Guardsmania,Alden  Brett  ChipPS Scroll below to see details of the mountain, our climb, links for satellite updates and where to donate.PPS If you want to learn more about the 75 year history of The Guardsmen click here .About Aconguaga and Expedition Logistics:Aconguaga is located in the Andes in the western Mendoza province of Argentina and is the second highest of the Seven Summits of the world.Standing at 22,835 feet it is the tallest mountain in the Western Hemisphere. Departing from Mendoza, Argentina we hope to complete this climb in 15 days, while establishing base camps at 14,000, 16,000 and 18,000 feet. While not as technical as Denali the amount of time spent at altitude makes this an equally challenging and difficult climb to the highest peak outside the Himalayan mountain range. To get an idea of the general 21 day literary and altitudes, click here: https://www.rmiguides.com/aconcagua/itineraryHere is a link where you can get satellite updates of our expedition: https://www.rmiguides.com/blog/entriesFinal Comments:For all of those who know us well, you know how strongly we feel about the opportunities The Guardsmen Scholarship Program provides at-risk youth in the Bay Area. During our tenure (2000-2009) in the group we were active in leadership roles and annual fundraising. The camaraderie and lifelong friendships we’ve strengthened through climbing together is in large part due to meeting one another as Guardsmen in 2000. As we attempt our highest climb yet, we want to enhance this experience by giving back to the group that introduced us. While we aren’t asking anyone to climb Aconguaga, we are asking you to consider supporting the Guardsmen Scholarship Endowment. NO AMOUNT IS TOO SMALL and any donation is very much appreciated…it is afterall, for the kids!THANK YOU!The Guardsmen makes a life-changing difference in the lives of at-risk youth by raising funds for scholarship, campership and other youth programs. We mobilize the talents, energy and resources of our members, friends, families, and professional colleagues, and in so doing strengthen our entire community.Read more

title: ski for tsuki 2
Description: This is always a very emotional time of year as we approach the anniversary of my daughter's birth and death. Tsukiko (Japanese for Moonchild) was born January 7, 2014 and was with us for merely a few hours before passing from this world. 8 years ago today, we were excitedly anticipating the birth of our first child. Friday January 7, 2022 would have been her 8th birthday. It has been a difficult journey of grief and healing and I owe a lot to our family, friends and community. Last year, I skied 50km to honor her memory and raise money for The Compassionate Friends - a non-profit dedicated to supporting families after a child or family member dies. We managed to raise $4315 to go towards the important work of this amazing organization. This year, due to a persistent, chronic, minor injury (in my left arch) I unfortunately cannot commit to a 50km however, I will be skiing 22km for 2022!September 2021, I lost a dear friend to mental illness and suicide. I met Gary in ninth grade French class and had been close friends since that day 30 years ago. He was the kind of friend that was always there for you. No matter what. Every year, when I went home to BC to visit, he would take the time off of work and we would go adventure and ride bikes. I miss him dearly and this year I will be skiing to honor his memory as well.The days, weeks and months after the death of Tsukiko were undoubtedly the hardest of my life. The intense grief I experienced was so deep there were times I didn't know how I would survive. During this time, I found that having other people to talk to who have had similar experiences of loss had the greatest impact on my healing journey.The Compassionate Friends is a national organization with 600 chapters around the country. In small towns and large cities, bereaved parents, siblings, and grandparents meet together to talk, listen, share, and provide each other emotional support after the devastating death of a child. I know the importance of the work that they do and that is why I want to raise money for their cause in honor of the memory of my daughter Tsuki.Read more

title: bob lokenlokenstrong
Description: It is with heavy hearts that we are posting this.Bob has passed away from stage 4 pancreatic cancer this morning.Kyle, Caden, and Maddie are here again for this post. We are deeply saddened to let you all know that our dad has passed away early this morning. We are very sad but yet somewhat relieved that our dad is not suffering to this disease and sickness anymore. We just want to again extend our thanks and appreciation to you all throughout this journey. We know our dad is a warrior and we got to see it first hand. He stayed breathing until we were all awake at his side this morning. Thank you all for the support as my dad was often moved to tears to see how many people he had touched and loved throughout his career and life. Your support has truly kept him fighting and as we have had some family talks, we learned that he wasn’t scared and it is “just life” as he would say to us. He thanks and loved you all a million times over. #lokenstrong100% of your donation goes to support Loken family during this difficult time.Thomas Richards Charity's purpose is to provide help and support to persons in need within my community. We deliver value through the design and execution of charitable acts in accordance with section 501c3 of the Internal Revenue Code. Our community is defined as a fellowship with others, as a result of sharing common attitudes, interests, and goals, in service of helping others.Read more

title: meklinabedini
Description: Varfëria është sfida më e madhe me të cilën shqiptarët po përballen sot. Në këto ditë të vështira ku mjerimi ka mbuluar me një vel trishtimi familjet shqiptare, ka ardhur koha t’i japim dorën njëri tjetrit dhe të bashkojmë zemrat në emër të së mirës. Fundjavë Ndryshe ka vendosur të jetë në krah të çdo shqiptari që sot ka nevojë për ndihmën tonë. Dhuro edhe ti kontributin tënd për t’i ndryshuar jetën dikujt që ka nevojë për ty.Ne bashkepunim me emisionin StopDhuro për të mësuar sa shumë forcë ke në shpirt për të shpëtuar jetë dhe për të ndezur dritë në ato zemra, ku dikur varfëria kishte pllakosur errësirën!Deri tani Fundjavë Ndryshe ka restauruar 170 shtëpi dhe ka ndërtuar211 të tjera për familjet në nevojë, të cilat jetonin ne kushte ekstreme. Ka shpërndarë rreth 200 bursa studimi për fëmijët në nevojë, dhe synon të zhvillojë programe integrimi social për të gjithë fëmijët e familjeve që trajtohen. Janë vizituar rreth 19 mijë familje në të gjithë Shqipërinë, dhe u është ofruar ndihma mjekësore rreth 80 individëve. Janë punësuar rreth 300 kryefamiljarë, si dhe është skicuar harta e varfërisë në të gjithë vendin. Sot ne jemi 10 mijë vullnetarë, te gatshëm për të luftuar varfërinë. Këto statistika tregojnë se të gjithë bashkë mundemi! Fundjavë Ndryshe jemi të gjithë ne! Email: [email redacted] Website : www.fundjavendryshe.org Facebook Fundjavë NdrysheInstagramRead more

title: 69wqaa emergency flood relief
Description: Little Hill Sanctuary is a 501(c)(3) non-profit farmed animal rescue and sanctuary that seeks to create a more kind world through rescuing and protecting animals from cruelty, providing them with sanctuary and compassionate care, and combating speciesism through promoting veganism.Late Sunday around midnight without warning a flash flood tore through the sanctuary. Many of the pastures flooded and we spent all night in the pouring rain bringing nearly 100 animals to safety on higher ground. We are so grateful that no lives were lost and everyone is now safe despite some minor injuries. That is what is important. And that is what we are trying to focus on. But the devastating destruction and property loss we have suffered is something we never could have imagined. Fencing is damaged. Walls have been torn from buildings. Feed storage has been completely flooded. Tools, halters, pumps, generators, lumber and fencing supplies have all been washed away and replaced by so much littered trash from nearby roadways everywhere. We have a lot of damage to assess and we have a lot of clean up to do. The losses will be in the tens of thousands if not more. And the rain still has not stopped. Please help the sanctuary rebuild. We can not do this without our community of support. We need you now more than ever.❤Read more

title: raiden science foundation
Description: We are launching a GoFundMe campaign this holiday season to accelerate promising research & therapeutic development for UBA5. UBA5 is a rare progressive neurological genetic disorder. There have been less than 30 genetically confirmed and reported cases in the world. Life expectancy is unknown, and kids impacted can suffer from movement disability, cognitive impairment, and uncontrollable epilepsy. There are no effective treatments or cures currently for UBA5 disease.Our son, Raiden Pham, suffers from UBA5 disease. He is still young and slowly progressing cognitively. While Raiden is at high risk for seizures, they have not yet begun and so we are racing against time. If we can deliver gene therapy for Raiden soon enough, we may be able to reverse his disease trajectory and give him a better quality of life. We are not giving up on him. Read about Raiden’s Story and follow his journey on Instagram @Raiden_Journey.We founded the Raiden Science Foundation (“RSF”) to enable impactful research to help Raiden and other patients suffering from UBA5 disease. Visit our websiteOur MISSION is to harness to power of family, community, and science to accelerate development of UBA5 therapies. We are breaking down research barriers to advance gene therapy for UBA5. Raiden was diagnosed in August, and within 2 months, we established a partnership with UMass Chan Medical School to make this more than just a hope. The UMass team will be creating a gene replacement therapy program for UBA5 once we raise funds.Our VISION is to create a future where there are paths forward for treating rare diseases and empowering families to make a difference. Not only will our work lead to giving kids suffering from UBA5 disease a chance for a better quality of life, but we are also pushing forward medical innovation that can help millions suffering from rare diseases around the world. We are currently exploring additional research partnerships with St. Jude Children’s Hospital, Baylor College of Medicine, and Oregon Health & Science University. Read about our workThe only way Raiden and potentially other UBA5 patients can receive gene therapy within 3 years is to raise $1+ million to start the research program. Time keeps marching forward for Raiden, but it hasn’t yet started for UBA5 gene therapy development.Together, we can do this.Please donate if you can and/or share this campaign with your friends, family, and colleagues.No donations will be used for Raiden’s care or other personal use. Raiden Science Foundation is an Oregon nonprofit operating through a fiscal sponsorship with Rare Village Foundation, a Texas 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization. Donations to RSF are tax-deductible within the guidelines of U.S. law. Rare Village Foundation will manage the funds and ensure that they will go directly to Raiden Science Foundation to only accomplish our mission.Read more

title: help me see by helping other kids
Description: My name is Coby Pollack. I’m a typical teenager, or at least I was a few weeks ago. I played basketball, watched videos, and went to school. A few weeks ago I mentioned to my mom that I was having trouble seeing clearly.My mom thought I needed glasses, but as it turns out, something is very wrong with my eyes and glasses won’t help. Slowly but surely, my eyesight is failing. I’m going to random hospitals and undergoing multiple procedures. I never saw it coming (sorry for the pun, I’m trying to stay upbeat).So many people are praying for me, and asking what they can do to help. The truth is, none of us “see” what other people are going through. I’d rather help others before myself. Can you please help me raise money to help other kids?I’m working with the MJYA Foundation to send kids to camp, give kids extra curricular activities, and so much more.In the merit of helping others, I’m hoping that I’m able to regain the gift of sight.Thank you so much!Read more

title: 7hr9ed olivias mitzvah project
Description: Hi Friends and Family,In honor of becoming a bat mitzvah and in lieu of a party, my mom and I will be traveling to Morocco to participate in a meaningful mitzvah project at the Atlas Kinder Foundation to help support abandoned Moroccan children. The Atlas Kinder Foundation was founded in 2015 and funded the creation of a very special village called Dar Bouidar that is located in the High Atlas mountains in a town called Tahanoute, just outside of Marrakech. The village currently supports the lives of 175 abandoned children ranging in age from newborn to 14 years old that call Dar Bouidar their home. The village provides these children with the opportunity to have a meaningful life with shelter, food, education, clothing, all medical needs and the love of foster moms who are there to care for them daily. The goal for my mitzvah project is to raise both awareness and funds for the foundation. When I learned that there are over 10,000 children that are left abandoned every year in Morocco I knew I wanted to help and make a meaningful difference in another child’s life.Our goal is to raise $4200.00 to sponsor one child at the village throughout the year. 100% of the funds I raise will go towards supporting the child’s daily living expenses that include shelter, food, education, clothing, medical needs and care.My mom planned a very special mother/daughter trip in early March to visit Dar Bouidar and spend time with the children and staff at the village. The experience of meeting the children and learning more about their lives and the issue of abandonment is meant to bring greater appreciation, meaningful connections and to see first hand the impact these funds will have on the lives of the children.Please consider supporting my mitzvah project with a tax deductible donation of any amount. At a time when everything feels uncertain, nothing feels better than giving back and doing some good. With your help, we look forward to making a real difference.Every dollar raised will be used to support the children of Dar Bouidar. I want to make a lasting impact.10,000 children are abandoned in Morocco every year. Afak’s goal is to eradicate this problem and provide every single abandoned child with a proper home and a bright future.Thank youxx, OliviaRead more

title: halifax retales 10th anniversary
Description: 10 years, wow!In March of 2011, I had a serious break in my mental health and almost made a final decision, I'm glad I didn't make it. I was in denial. I didn't think "that" affected me, but I suffered from depression for years, as well as a couple of learning disabilities.I just kept my emotions bottled up and kept pushing them down.Then I broke!With some work, I could finally accept it was okay not to be okay!Part of my healing was to put positive ideas out there and connect with my community. I had always had a curiosity for what is opening and closing it was our small talk in a group of friends. I thought if we enjoy it maybe others will too.So, on January 16, 2012, I set up a Twitter account and tweeted "Welcome to Retail updates around the HRM" and Halifax ReTales was born. I was hoping to have 500 followers someday.It has been so rewarding. I have met so many fantastic people that make up the fabric of HRM.ReTales has grown so much a total following of over 125k across Twitter, Facebook and Instagram.I have been producing a weekly blog post every Sunday recapping the highlights of the week for nearly 7 years. As well as sending out in a weekly email. 3 years ago I also started writing a weekly column in The Chronicle Herald as well.It has always remained freeand now...here is my askIf you value Halifax ReTales and the decade of work I have put in to get people engaged in HRM or made your life a little more fun, helping you discover something that you now consider a favourite.I ask you to help others find comfort in their mental health and say thank you to me by donating to the Mental Health Foundation Of Nova Scotia.Thanks for being part of my journey, and thanks Halifax for being such a great inspiration.Love ArthurMore information about the Mental Health Foundation Of Nova Scotia: The Mental Health Foundation of Nova Scotia is a registered charity that aims to increase financial support to community initiatives throughout Nova Scotia while providing hope and eradicating the stigma surrounding mental illness and addiction. Our mission is to make a difference in the lives of Nova Scotians by supporting mental health and addiction initiatives. Our vision is a future where Nova Scotians living with mental illness and addiction are thriving in our communities.This fundraiser will end Jan 21, 2022Read more

title: santa save the sidebar
Description: Hey all, I need your help once again!I know it's right before Christmas, but we need your giving spirit and love of music to shine through right now. These last two years have been very hard on small venues like the Sidebar and not much relief was handed down from the legislation that was supposed to help. To keep Sidebar open and running, Feed The Scene Foundation Inc has been offered the opportunity to BUY THE SIDEBAR! Our plan is to have the non-profit purchase the business and the liquor license and run the bar as an open source non-profit so it will constantly endow itself for its own longevity. We would like to make a serious nod back to Mike Riley and his creation of the Charm City Art Space by making the Sidebar a place for everyone with a collective of promoters and other volunteers who care to help keep it running. All bartenders and staff will make livable wages and anything considered profit will be put back into the bar in terms of improvements or upgrades or guarantees for bands. No one on the Feed The Scene staff will be taking a salary from the bar. This is a labor of love.Now, you might be saying, "WAIT RACHEL HOW CAN I HELP?!?!?" HERE IS HOW!!! We need your donations. We are trying to raise $80,000 to cover the purchase, transfer of all legal property, liquor license, utilities, sound system, Etc ($50,000) and the remaining $30,000 is to cover a host of fixes the bar needs that may impede passing inspections we need for permits under new ownership. We will be keeping a public accounting of all funds that anyone can ask to see at any time. Anything raised over $80k will go to hopefully creating a usable greenroom on the lower level for bands and our drag shows. The best part is, because we are already a non-profit, all your donations are 100% tax deductible, so your giving helps you too!This whole endeavor is solely to make sure we don't lose the the only remaining small capacity, all-ages venue with a liquor license left in the city. This venue means so much to our local and national music community and we hope that even if you can't spare a dollar, that you can amplify the signal.Thank you so much,Rachel Taft, Kayleigh Lydick, Bobbie Dickerson, Bart Shiflett, Casey Severn, Nika Watkins, Jamie Schubert-Reitz and Feed The Scene Foundation Inc.Read more
