title: una casa para monjas budistas
Description: Durante 12 años, mientras servimos y difundimos el Dharma, nos hemos estado moviendo de un lugar a otro, en la India, México y los Estados Unidos, viviendo en lugares alquilados o prestados, intentando siempre mantener nuestra forma de vida monástica y sirviendo a nuestra querida comunidad laica hispano parlante. Empezamos como cuatro monjas budistas y somos ahora cinco. Varias mujeres nos han estado preguntando si ellas pueden tomar votos y unirse a nosotras, sin embargo, por carecer de un lugar de residencia permanente, no podemos atender sus solicitudes. Con el fin de ofrecer oportunidades a otras mujeres y atender a nuestra comunidad amplia que también está creciendo, ahora estamos planeando echar raíces y crear una base estable. ¡Ayúdanos a crear un hogar!A lo largo de los años, nos hemos conocido a través de los proyectos de FaceBuda, el Instituto Budadharma, las Salas de meditación Dharmadatta, y confiamos que ahora, con las aportaciones de tantas personas, por el poder colectivo podemos hacer realidad este lugar.Aquí en este sitio, vamos avanzando juntos hacia la meta. Súmate. Somos muchos. Aunque parezca lejos, juntas y juntos, con todo lo que cada quien pueda contribuir, lo lograremos.Te invitamos a regresar de vez en cuando a este sitio para ir viendo nuestro colectivo y regocijarnos por ello.QUIÉNES SOMOS: Una comunidad internacional de monjas budistas hispanoparlantes. Estamos profundamente comprometidas a crear un nuevo modelo de comunidad espiritual alejado de actitudes e instituciones patriarcales, a abrazar la responsabilidad de cuidar a la tierra, y a servir a nuestra comunidad laica de habla hispana.Damcho, monja durante 22 años, con un doctorado en Sánscrito y experiencia en periodismo. Originaria de Nueva York. Nuestra líder reluctante.Nangpel, monja durante 13 años, nacida en México, anteriormente investigadora académica. Cinta negra en aikido: con ella, ninguna de nosotras baja la guardia.Lodro, monja durante 7 años, anteriormente contadora, nacida en la República Dominicana y muy joven emigrada a Puerto Rico. Encargada no oficial de “risoterapia”.Dapel, monja durante 13 años, nacida en Suiza. Profesora de primaria antes de ordenarse. Con esta voz, tiene que ser nuestra “líder de canto”.Karya, nuestra monja más nueva, de Colombia. Profesora universitaria con un posgrado en semiótica.QUÉ HACEMOS:Para nosotras es muy importante que las desigualdades económicas no sean un impedimento para acceder al cuidado y a los servicios espirituales, particularmente en el budismo. Por esta razón ofrecemos todas nuestras actividades completamente libres de pago: retiros de meditación, sesiones de práctica en grupo en línea, cursos en línea y un programa de estudios de siete años de duración. Nuestras ofrendas y servicios de Dharma están disponibles y abiertos a cualquiera que hable español. De acuerdo con el mayor ejemplo budista, el Buda mismo, vivimos de las donaciones que recibimos. Y gracias a las y los amables donantes logramos cubrir los costos para vivir.Sin embargo, la necesidad de contar con un espacio estable para vivir se ha agudizado ahora. La cantidad que necesitamos reunir nos permitiría comenzar nuestro viaje hacia una sede estable. Tenemos un largo camino por recorrer y no podemos hacerlo solas. ¿Nos puedes ayudar a hacerlo?Cuando empezamos juntas, estábamos convencidas de que antes de construir un monasterio físico, era importante desarrollar primero los vínculos personales y las prácticas grupales que nos llevarían a ser una verdadera comunidad. Estamos felices de haber puesto el enfoque ahí en nuestra primera década, pero ahora realmente necesitamos establecernos en un lugar propio, que será también un lugar para ofrecer al mundo. Anhelamos crear un espacio seguro que podamos llenar con la energía de nuestra práctica y de nuestro amor, y ofrecer ese espacio como refugio a los demás. Anhelamos cuidar la tierra y soñamos en custodiar un bosque.¿Nos ayudarás a comprar una casa que pueda servir como base para que podamos seguir cuidando a la comunidad laica, mientras mantenemos nuestra vida contemplativa como monjas?Puedes ver el enfoque que ofrecemos en nuestro canal de YouTube. Encontrarás ahí series de enseñanzas sobre temas como trabajar con emociones difíciles, identidades de género, cultivar la generosidad con un corazón abierto, la compasión valiente y otras cualidades positivas, la conciencia y la acción ambiental, la simplicidad voluntaria y los sutras Mahayana. Nuestro canal tiene más de 160 000 suscriptores y esto nos permite llegar y beneficiar a muchas personas que no son budistas, así como a aquellas que de otro modo no tendrían acceso a un centro de Dharma. Desde la pandemia, cientos de personas se han unido a nuestros retiros de meditación en línea y han tomado cursos en nuestro instituto en línea. Nuestras salas de meditación, siempre abiertas, sirven a más de 35 000, todo de forma totalmente gratuita.Canal de YouTube "faceBuda" youtube.com/user/faceBuda/featuredSalas de meditación en línea (Salas de meditación Dharmadatta) budismoenlinea.ning.com/Cursos en línea (Instituto Budadharma) institutobudadharma.org/Programa de estudios de siete años institutobudadharma.org/programa-de-formacion/Para nosotras, la gratitud es fundamental, y todo lo que puedas ofrecer se apreciará profundamente y será utilizado con cuidado. Esta oportunidad de pedir tu ayuda es también una oportunidad para conectar y expandir las redes de compasión y cuidado que estamos construyendo. Si decides donar, por favor indícanos cómo te gustaría que dediquemos aspiraciones por ti. Hacemos plegarias dos veces al día por todas y todos nuestros benefactores.Con las palmas juntas, te damos las gracias de corazón, Damcho, Dapel, Karya, Lodro y Nangpel (y Tashi, nuestro amigo canino residente).Read more

title: woodys care
Description: Want to join me in making a difference? I'm raising money to benefit Belmont County Hoof & Paw Inc, and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to me.More information about Belmont County Hoof & Paw Inc: Our mission is to provide humane treatment of animals, prevention of cruelty, abuse, neglect, and exploitation of the animals of Belmont County, Ohio, to educate the public as to the proper care of animals, and to assist with or initiate the prosecution of those who mistreat animals.Read more

title: ultra run for a cause montauk to central park
Description: On January 8, 2022, I will be running from Montauk to Manhattan to raise funds for Long Island Crisis Center, a nonprofit that provides 24/7, free, high quality, confidential and non-judgemental programs and services to support and empower Long Islanders at critical times in their lives.The run will begin at 6 A.M., Saturday in Montauk (at Montauk Point State Park) and finish in Manhattan (at Strawberry Fields Monument in Central Park).Nearly 1 in every 5 adults experiences some form of mental illness.  Now is no better time to bring awareness to this medical condition.  Together as a community, we can do this!  I am not specialist in the field, and I can only speak from personal experience.  Depression, suicidal thoughts and anxiety have always been a struggle for me.  As I have grown, so did my mental issues.  One of the ways I have overcome my thoughts and feelings was through running.  There is something magical about it for me.  Being by myself and learning to love and embrace loneliness allows me to reconsider how beautiful my life really is.  Not only has running allowed me to connect with an amazing community of people, I now know that I am never alone.  This run is my way of bringing awareness to something that effects so many of us, yet is so often not talked about.  Read more

title: help waldorf cape cod build a wood shop
Description: I am seeking help from supporters of hands-on education in raising funds for a wood shop at our school.The Waldorf School of Cape Cod has made a tremendous comeback after a few challenging years and we are settling in to a new location in Sandwich and beginning to regrow in many ways. This includes the return of the woodworking program, which was on hiatus for 3 years. We are proud to be one of few schools offering traditional hand-tool woodworking to elementary- and middle school-age students.So far this school year, the kids and I have had a blast building skills and cool projects including cutting boards, a pallet wood compost bin for the school garden, mortise and tenon stools and model wigwams!Like every organization in the early stages of regrowth, our school faces challenges in making sure the available resources keep up with the increasing population and enthusiasm. One of these challenges is the current lack of a space for woodworking classes.So far this year, we have held classes outside in the school’s backyard, first under a canopy tent and then, after our tent was damaged beyond repair by a storm, out in the open. There are obvious obstacles at play in this situation due to weather, lack of proper tool storage and work surfaces, and a host of logistical challenges.Despite the challenges, the children have come to woodworking class excited and ready to make progress every day, no matter how cold, wet or windy it has been. Their positivity has been inspiring!And if they were able to practice their craft in a space with a roof and walls? One can only imagine what we could accomplish!With that in mind, I am hoping to raise a substantial portion of the amount needed to purchase a 14’x24’ build-it-ourselves post and beam barn kit. This type of building is cost-effective and sturdy. True to the community spirit of our school, it would be erected by our own team of volunteers, even providing opportunities for students to participate in the construction of their own wood shop!We appreciate any support in our effort in this ever-important mission: Preserving opportunities for children to work creatively with their hands in a safe and nurturing environment!Some incentives for donors:$100 or more your name will be displayed on a commemorative plaque to be hung in the new shop$200 or more, you will receive a poplar cheese board courtesy of WSCC woodworkers$500 or more, you will receive a custom wood-carved sign made with the help of WSCC woodworking students$5000 or more, naming rights to the new wood shop!waldorfcapecod.orgRead more

title: rapid tests for robust learning
Description: Lafayette Preparatory Academy (LPA) is a small, public charter school in St. Louis City that serves students in Kindergarten through 8th grade. During the ongoing pandemic, LPA has been a leader in the community through collaborative planning between an incredibly dedicated staff and engaged family base. The cooperative effort between home and school have resulted in ongoing support for students. Incredibly, LPA saw academic growth in both Reading and Science through the state-mandated MAP tests in the Spring of 2021 as well as growth on their annual Panorama survey (measuring social emotional learning). All of this through a year of hybrid learning, with approximately 40% of the student body learning virtually for the entire year. LPA has remained diligent in mitigation strategies to keep students safe and in school, including weekly COVID testing through a state-funded initiative. Creative problem-solving, coupled with incredible teamwork has resulted in fewer class quarantines and overall satisfaction from families and staff alike.  However, the new Omicron variant led to staff shortages and higher rates of student infection after winter break. Increased infections rates coupled with a testing shortage led to the difficult decision to move all students to virtual learning for the week of January 10th. COVID-19 rapid tests are experiencing a shortage right now. Though LPA is part of a grant-funded program which includes 160 tests every other week, the regular shipments stopped in December. To ensure LPA is able to resume in-person learning, while ensuring students are as safe as possible during this time, LPA purchased 360 tests from an independent company. The good news is that they have shipped! However, this expense was not anticipated in the general operating budget and without additional help, cuts will need to be made to the budget to accommodate this expense. Your donation, no matter how large or small will ensure students have access to adequate COVID testing  during this difficult time.  Schools should not have to decide between a student's health and their educational opportunities.  Any funds raised in excess of the requested amount will support the increased expenses LPA has sustained in ensuring students are outfitted with proper masks (an additional $2K-$3K expense so far) and to support our ongoing "Student Support Fund" which ensures students (and their families) in need have access to supplies, technology, food, and services. Thank you for your support.Read more

title: tornado relief aframermuseum
Description: The Dec 10-11 tornadoes hit the African American Museum of Bowling Green, Kentucky. A week later, the electricity was turned back on but within a few hours a fire occurred. While the building is no longer habitable, the collection has been salvaged by museum workers in the region and is currently being stored at the Kentucky Museum and Corvette Museum.Unfortunately, insurance will not go far enough to clean and preserve the entire collection - including priceless photographs, documents, and objects that document our vibrant African American regional heritage. While we are applying for grants, securing those take time. The longer we wait for funding, the more soot and water damage can harm the collection.That’s where we need your help!This fundraiser will help by:- Secure a Kentucky-based conservator to evaluate the collection and provide recommended treatment plans for the damaged objects.- Purchase a new computer for inventorying the collection.- Seed fund treatment for the collection and/or securing a new space for the African American Museum.- Once the above are complete, any remaining funds will provide the basis for a permanent endowment to help us resume operations and, we hope, hire a full-time Curator.All funds raised go directly to the African-American Museum, a registered 501c3 charity.Thanks in advance for your contribution!Read more

title: carlie brieres bsa eagle project
Description: My name is Carlie Briere. I'm a 13 yr old Life Scout in troop 209 located in Newton, MA. I've partnered with the Vietnam Veterans Workshop, Inc. dba New England Center and Home for Veterans as part of my Eagle Scout Project..The Shelter has 275 beds and the Veterans filling those beds are in desperate need of warm clothing and toiletries. As my project, I'm building each and every one of these veterans a winter clothing care package.  At a minimum it will contain a quality sweat shirt hoodie, sweat pants, wool socks and toiletry kit containing shaving and hygiene items.Sweat Shirts and Sweat pants are of extreme importance at this time of year because they can be used as pajamas during the cold winter nights in the shelter and as an extra layer of clothing during the day. The donations I receive are tax deductible and will go directly toward buying the items mentioned above.Your generosity is greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance for donating.Carlie BriereRead more

title: support student journalism at ub
Description: For 71 years, The Spectrum has provided an essential service to the UB community free of charge. Our student journalists have worked tirelessly to produce award-winning journalism that inspires change. Dozens of students have won national journalism awards. Even more have gone onto careers at local, regional and national publications. This is a testament to the generations of students who have worked day-and-night to deliver an impactful product for the benefit of the UB community.But putting together a high-quality publication comes with a steep price tag. As we continue to shift toward a digital-first format, we are confronted with a number of rising costs: staff salaries, printing, digital equipment, web development and insurance. We rely on the contributions of supporters like you to keep us going. You can help The Spectrum continue to produce high-quality journalism by supporting our publication financially. Your donation would mean so much to us.Thank you for supporting our publication,Reilly Mullen, editor-in-chief 2021-22Justin Weiss, managing editor 2021-22The Spectrum Student Periodical, Inc. plans to use this contribution in the manner suggested, The Spectrum Student Periodical, Inc. retains unilateral authority to redirect the use of this contribution to other related purposes, if necessary.Read more

title: fundraiser for shiv durga hindu temples new site
Description: Dear Devotees,We are pleased to announce the purchase of a new building (permanent Mandir) for Shiv Durga Hindu Temple (SDHT) at the intersection of Route 59 and Ogden Ave (Heart of Naperville, IL USA). We need you and your support to fulfill this dream.Mission Statement:To provide religious and spiritual services to the Hindu diaspora and to promote educational, social, cultural values, and interfaith outreach within the surrounding communities.Providing a place of worship in the Chicago land area for Hindu and congregationProviding an educational and a cultural center for the community at largeSponsoring and conducting religious, spiritual, educational, social, and cultural activitiesEmbellish and preserve Hindu heritage and promote the tradition of our rich cultureEnhance religious experience and philosophy to the diverse congregational groups, especially the younger generationDeveloping congregational responsibility and recognizing and respecting interfaith beliefsRead more

title: raise wisconsins environmental education voice
Description: The Wisconsin Association for Environmental Education is about to take a huge step.  We're hiring an executive director this spring, but it takes funding to ensure this step is sustainable. Dr. Rick Wilke, an environmental education researcher and statewide leader, has offered a generous one time donation of $5000. But only if we raise a matching $5000.  We need you (and your co-workers, friends and family) to help.Environmental education has been hit hard in Wisconsin- first by political gamesmanship that eliminated structural support like the Wisconsin Environmental Education Board and then by the impacts of COVID-19. The WAEE Executive Director will serve as a consistent voice for environmental education in our state and help us provide more opportunities for networking, EE advocacy and recognition- the three pillars of our work.Help the Wisconsin Association for Environmental Education raise $5000by January 15, 2022. If we reach our goal donations are matched and that's $10,000 for environmental education. Every donation helps build a future where more Wisconsin communities have a chance to connect with nature.Read more

title: crystels fundraiser to build a fence
Description: Hi, my name is Crystel Denton and I am the Founder/President of Ranger's Legacy Equine Rescue. We rescue, rehabilitate, and rehome abandoned, abused, neglected, and starved horses in New Mexico and Surrounding states.Can you help us? Before we moved our facility to our Roswell, NM property, our new next door neighbor had removed the majority of our perimeter fencing on our 49 acres. Some of his property butts up to ours so when he puts cattle in this particular pasture, they have access to our property. He has hundreds of acres and several different pastures he can put them in. Last year, he sold them after a couple of months saying he would not be bringing them back until the drought was over. During that time, I asked him to please put our fence back up before bringing any more cattle in which he kept telling me was our responsibility. Cut to present time. He has, once again, put cattle on the property surrounding ours. We are spending hours and days fixing fence (my horse pens are hotwire because we cannot afford to put up other fencing) and filling water tanks. We are constantly pushing cattle and Hannah and I cannot leave our property together. One of us always has to be here. This is where YOU come in. We need your help.We need to build our perimeter fence back as soon as possible. I have spoken with an attorney and we can win a lawsuit against our neighbor, but it would cost us up to $50,000 and take some time. In the meantime, his cattle will continue to destroy our fences, drink our water, and over graze our land. My thought is this; if you are going to help us with the funds, then lets raise less and do more! We need you because we cannot do it alone!As much as I would like to make an example of the neighbor, our money and time is better spent building a new fence. We need to raise, at least, $12,000 to get a fencing company to come in and get the fencing done right and done quick. You can make this happen! You can help to ensure that the horses are safe, that we are safe, and we can get back to what we are really here for. Helping those horses that need us to give them a second chance. We are asking you to help us regain our property because we need you to be able to get it done right!Will you give a gift of $10 or $25 to start us on our way to reaching our goal? Thank you for considering joining us in our quest to get our property re-fenced to keep the neighbors' cattle out!#letsbuildafence#wecandoit#smallbusinessreliefRead more

title: light up masjid appeal
Description: Assalamualaikum Brothers and Sisters,The Muslim Community of Glen Allen VA, is asking for your support. title: teshpetojmeauroren
Description: Varfëria është sfida më e madhe me të cilën shqiptarët po përballen sot. Në këto ditë të vështira ku mjerimi ka mbuluar me një vel trishtimi familjet shqiptare, ka ardhur koha t’i japim dorën njëri tjetrit dhe të bashkojmë zemrat në emër të së mirës. Fundjavë Ndryshe ka vendosur të jetë në krah të çdo shqiptari që sot ka nevojë për ndihmën tonë. Dhuro edhe ti kontributin tënd për t’i ndryshuar jetën dikujt që ka nevojë për ty.Se bashku me shume se 100 operacione me sukses!Dhuro për të mësuar sa shumë forcë ke në shpirt për të shpëtuar jetë dhe për të ndezur dritë në ato zemra, ku dikur varfëria kishte pllakosur errësirën!Deri tani Fundjavë Ndryshe ka restauruar 170 shtëpi dhe ka ndërtuar 211 të tjera për familjet në nevojë, të cilat jetonin ne kushte ekstreme. Ka shpërndarë rreth 200 bursa studimi për fëmijët në nevojë, dhe synon të zhvillojë programe integrimi social për të gjithë fëmijët e familjeve që trajtohen. Janë vizituar rreth 19 mijë familje në të gjithë Shqipërinë, dhe u është ofruar ndihma mjekësore rreth 80 individëve. Janë punësuar rreth 300 kryefamiljarë, si dhe është skicuar harta e varfërisë në të gjithë vendin. Sot ne jemi 10 mijë vullnetarë, te gatshëm për të luftuar varfërinë. Këto statistika tregojnë se të gjithë bashkë mundemi! Fundjavë Ndryshe jemi të gjithë ne! Email: [email redacted] Website : www.fundjavendryshe.org Facebook Fundjavë NdrysheInstagramRead more

title: save cinema paradiso hollywood
Description: Cinema Paradiso Hollywood was established in 2013 and is the only movie theatre in Downtown Hollywood, Florida. The cute, state-of-the-art cinema seats 82 people and serves beer, wine, soft drinks, popcorn, hot dogs and candy. In addition, CPH shows films from around the world plus the latest Hollywood Blockbusters. It is programmed by the 37 year-old Fort Lauderdale Int'l Film Festival.Like all small businesses, COVID has knock us for a loop. We have to pay the distributors, up to 62 cents for every dollar spent on admissions. That leaves a terribly small margin to cover operating expenses.Won't you JOIN US in keeping the magic alive in Hollywood? There are three ways you can help to SAVE CINEMA PARADISO:1) Make whatever donation you can to this campaign.2) Become a Member of FLIFF at https://fliff.com/join3) Come to the Cinema often and bring friends!Read more

title: dxjam dazzers big shave
Description: Hi there my name is Darrell , i am raising money in aid of MSWA and every donation will help.In November 2020 after complications with his vision and following various tests culminating in an MRI scan our son Jake was diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis.Jake was just turning 29 and this came as a huge shock as he was previously in good health.Thanks to the care and support of health practioners , Neurologists and staff at Fiona Stanley Hospital Jake's vision finally returned and he now receives a monthly infusion of Natalizumab (Tysabri) , a disease modifying drug to assist with his ongoing care.Some time ago i decided to grow a beard with a view to raising funds and awareness of Multiple Sclerosis Western Australia .MSWA is a Non Government , Not for Profit charity that provides vital support , services and reaseach funding for sufferers of various types of Neurological disorders including MS , Motor Neuron Disease , Stroke and Parkinsons Disease to name but a few. Please visit mswa.org.au for more information about the work they do throughout the Western Australian community.After 7 months of no shaving and people i know failing to recognise me in the street , at least that's their excuse , i have set a date for 6th February for the Big Shave.I hope you and your friends and can donate what you can to MSWA to assist the great work they do.With your support I look forward to seeing my chin again soon.Many ThanksDarrell.Read more

title: happy betty white day bettywhitechallenge
Description: Betty White would have been 100 years old on January 17th. Heaven took this Angel from us before she could celebrate this huge milestone birthday, but we can still celebrate her life by standing together to help animals in need. Join the #BettyWhiteChallenge by choosing a local rescue or animal shelter and make a donation in Betty White’s name. All rescues and shelters need help right now more than ever! Betty would have loved this challenge. Let’s celebrate a truly great woman that lived her life with class, grace and kindness.Thank you for being a friend.Read more

title: help restore kuanyin for our temple
Description: On Sunday, 1/9/22, the Kuan-Yin Buddhist Association of Philadelphia faced a tragic act of vandalism. Outside of the temple, the Kuan-Yin statue, a symbol for peace and compassion, was torn down. An unidentified man had made attempts to tear down the statue before finally succeeding and knocking it down to the ground. It shattered Kuan-Yin's head and hands off of the statue, deeming it irreparable.This is a devastating loss for the Buddhist community. While this may seem like it's about a statue, it is much more than that. The Quan Yin statue represents the values of compassion, peace, and protection. For many temple-goers, praying to the statue provided comfort and solace for those facing turmoil. Seeing it destroyed marks a loss for this peace. The temple is currently collecting funds to replace the statue to provide its members with peace once again. The temple appreciates any support and help that it can receive during this painful time.If you would like to donate in other ways, you can send donations to the Kuan-Yin Buddhist Association of Philadelphia at 1239 Ridge Ave. Philadelphia, PA 19123.Click here to view the ABC6 article about the unfortunate incident.Read more

title: mybs field and park improvements
Description: Hello MYBS families and fans,We hope your new year is off to a great start. As you know, we are always looking for ways to improve the baseball and softball playing experience for our kids and the fan experience for people like you. To that end, we have two exciting projects on deck for this year:·    Regrade, fix, and fill in the softball infields at Wheelock, improving the quality, safety, and playing experience for our kids.·    Replace the 70-year old bleachers at Metacomet. While these bleachers have a lot of character and Medfield baseball history, they are unsafe. As you've probably experienced, there are no handrails and the old wood is in desperate need of repair. We are extremely fortunate to have a very generous private donation of $15K to start the bleacher project, but it’s going to cost more to complete.We've set up a this page to support these two important projects. Any additional funds beyond what we need for these projects will be put toward future projects aimed at improving our player and fan experiences. Medfield Youth Baseball and Softball is a 501c3 non-profit (Tax ID: 04-3078229), so your donations are tax deductible. And don’t forget to use your company matching program, too!Donate $500+ and receive a free engraved brick at the Swain Concession Stand at Metacomet Park!·    Every $500+ donation will receive a 4x8 engraved brick·    Every $1,000+ donation will receive an 8x8 engraved brickIf you'd prefer to send a donation via check, our address is Medfield Youth Baseball & Softball, PO Box 366, Medfield, MA 02052.Thank you, in advance, for any support you can provide.Read more

title: garrets promise at spirits promise
Description: As you know Garret passed away tragically on May 1st, 2021. Since then, we have been trying to figure out how we can allow his memory to live on forever. After researching different charities and considering a football scholarship in his honor, nothing felt quite right.Garret's passing has led us to a sanctuary of healing. Through group therapy, one on one counseling, volunteer work, and time at the farm, Spirit’s Promise has given us a second chance at life. We have smiled through times we only imagined would bring sadness, and found spiritual connections during times of utter despair. Spirit’s Promise has given us HOPE. We want to help give others a chance at restoring their lives the way Spirit’s Promise has been helping us to restore ours.When working with the family of Spirit's Promise, we realized there is a real opportunity to help, a real need that needs to be fulfilled. What has since developed is Garret's Promise. Garret's Promise is our commitment to the word promise. It's our promise to help autistic children, people in turmoil, people in grievance, and people who need hope. It's our promise to anyone who needs this promise in their lives, that we will be here to help them, and all in Garret's honor.Currently Spirit’s Promise operates strictly outdoors, limiting their scope of practice. Garret’s Promise, will bring an indoor round pen to the farm and will change the trajectory of how people experience Spirit’s Promise. This indoor sanctuary of healing will allow Spirit's Promise to help people no matter the time of year or the time of day. Rain or shine, day or night, Spirit’s Promise will be able to host community events, offer therapeutic programming, and bring love to those who feel unlovable.If you are so inclined, please help bring Garret's Promise to life. We hope you can become a part of our hope.Read more

title: fundraiser for banditas wild horse promise
Description: Want to join us in making a difference? We're raising money to benefit Banditas Wild Horse Promise, and any donation will help make an impact. Thanks in advance for your contribution to this cause that means so much to us.Banditas Wild Horse Promise was created after the devastating roundups in Sand Wash Basin. Several of us decided we needed to work together to help make a difference for the wild horses that have lost their freedom. We will focus on trying to reunite family bands. Some on our wish list are Kootenai, Bliss, River, Sundance, Rigel and Ladore.To mail a donation, please send checks to the following address, thank you!PO Box 881308 Steamboat Springs CO 80488Read more

title: urgent support for young mother crisis center
Description: Young Mother is a crisis and adaptation center that is located in eastern Ukraine on the frontlines of the war. Since June of 2011 they have served over 350 women, 420 children and 200 refugees from the war zone. As they escape impossible life circumstances and trauma, volunteers at Malinkaya mama provide the women and children with the hope, love, care and physical necessities they need to recover and create a healthy new begging for a better future. Recently, their only bus broke, leaving them without transportation to take the women and their children to many important places such as church, doctors' appointments, legal appointments, grocery shopping and more. The current bus is 17 years old and has served in a bike tour through all of Russia, a rehab center and now Young Mother for the past 8 years. Volunteers have made many repairs and faithfully maintained it over the years but this time it is beyond reason to repair. The women strive to be self-sufficient by selling homemade pickles and dumplings to support the needs of the center, along with support from the church and a monthly sponsorship for groceries. With 20 children and 13 mothers currently supported by the center there is simply not enough money to build a savings to afford the bus that they so urgently need. For this reason, we are seeking financial support to help them buy a new one so that they can continue serving women and children in need. We hope that God will give you a desire to take part in the restoration of lives in this way. Even if you alone cannot afford to help, please pray for them and share this need with your friends and family because together it is possible! God bless you and thank you!Read more

title: school supplies for wi afghan children refugees
Description: The refugee children at the Ft. McCoy U.S. Army base greatly need educational materials and supplies. As a result of needing to quickly flee for their lives, the children are without any school or educational materials as they wait for resettlement. Refugees who taught in Afghanistan are doing their best to act as teachers and continue their children’s education. Still, with virtually no materials, supplies, or curriculum, it becomes increasingly harder to accomplish. Now also with winter here, the children are indoors, with significantly fewer activities to do. Providing children with education materials will help the volunteers more effectively support the needs of the children. With around 1,000 kids at the base, we’re looking to provide each student with a backpack kit with supplies such as pencils, crayons, etc., along with picture dictionaries and workbooks to continue learning English. It takes about $80 to cover the cost of school and educational supplies for one child for the upcoming months until resettlement. All donations will go directly to purchasing these supplies for the children. Thank you for your help as we support our future neighbors in Wisconsin and beyond in their education! Read more

title: laurens fundraising for brain tumour research
Description: Hello everyone!My story. On November 28th 2021, 5 weeks after giving birth for the third time, I had a tonic seizure followed by a CT scan in A&E.  This showed a lesion growing in my brain that was approximately 5cmx4cm and had been pressing onto my brain,  giving some slight symptoms for 6 weeks.On several occasions, I experienced some confusion, loss of muscle control down my right arm/leg and loss of peripheral vision on the right.Initially I presumed I was tired from having a newborn baby and slightly stressed from having a busy lifestyle.These were focal seizures, without me realising.I had brain surgery on December 16th 2021 to remove the tumour by Mr Harshal Ingale at Queens Medical Centre. He was able to remove most of the tumour but left some in place due to it growing around a major blood vessel.Unfortunately the histology came back with the worst results possible. A stage 3 hemangiopericytoma. A rare and aggressive malignant tumour.At this stage I'm awaiting a CT chest, abdomen and pelvis scan to see if the tumour has spread elsewhere, before treating the brain tumour with radiotherapy. My fundraising.I have entered the Derby 10k which I plan to run on April 10th to raise money for the Brain Tumour Research charity. My hope is to raise money for them to put more research into this rare type of tumour as there is currently very little knowledge about it. For those of you who know me, you'll know how much of a passion I have for running and how I used to try and get out each day doing some buggy running.The last time I ran 10k was almost a year ago and after my recent diagnosis along with pregnancy, I've lost a whole lot of leg strength and fitness BUT...my training has begun!I continue to do a daily core/weights workout and I'm back out running again which feels truly amazing!I'm hoping to complete the 10k race in sub 60 minutes, even better if it's under 57:44 which was my finish time 7 years ago.I feel more determined than ever to build my strength and fitness up and truly believe it will help to get me through some of the difficult times ahead. Any contributions that are made would mean the absolute world to me and I appreciate the support through my fundraising journey. :) Thanks so much!Lauren xRead more

title: help the dc snowy owls homeless neighbors
Description: Over the past few weeks, wildlife enthusiasts in Washington, DC have been thrilled to see a young female Snowy Owl making regular nightly appearances on the plaza outside Union Station. The owl, believed to have been born last spring on the Arctic tundra of far northern Canada, journeyed thousands of miles south to spend the winter with us here, just within sight of the U.S. Capitol, helpfully reducing our rat population and drawing dozens of awed onlookers each night.Unfortunately, the owl is not the only one living outside on the plaza. A large number of unhoused people have been forced by circumstance to spend their nights sleeping outside Union Station in tents, often in temperatures well below freezing. While the owl's presence fills us with joy, that joy is diminished by the reminder that so many of our neighbors don't have anywhere else to go. And while Snowy Owls are well adapted to cold weather, human beings are not -- we need safe, clean, reliable shelter to survive and thrive.You can do something about this. Donations to this campaign will benefit Pathways to Housing DC, an organization that serves unhoused people in DC, including those in the encampment outside Union Station. Pathways provides street outreach to people experiencing homelessness, helping them find food, shelter, housing and employment. Pathways also operates an urgent care clinic and a day services center in downtown DC. Pathways is committed to the "housing first" model, which places people in housing without preconditions, then works with them to meet their health and employment needs. You can learn more about Pathways on their web site.If you're a fan of the owl, please give a helping hand to her human neighbors, who are also your neighbors. Together, we can work for a city where every owl hunts in peace and every person sleeps soundly indoors.Read more

title: yasmins parachute jump for breast cancer now
Description: Please join me in making a difference!I'm raising money to benefit Breast Cancer Now, and any donation will help make an impact.Below is my story Firstly, two questions:1- Did you know men can get breast cancer? 2- Did you know breast cancer can be genetic? Unfortunately I have learnt these both to be true and as such would like to raise awareness.My Story In 2014 over my 18th birthday my father was diagnosed with Breast Cancer and the age of 21 five years ago, I was diagnosed with having BRCA2 gene mutation.What this means is, I need a preventive double mastectomy and this is the fuel behind my fundraising for Breast Cancer Now. The BRCA2 mutation means I carry a much greater risk of developing breast, ovarian and pancreatic cancer in my life time. Breast Cancer carries the highest lifetime risk of up to 70% and as such preventative procedures were offered to me.The option I chose was a double mastectomy, removing both breasts, followed by reconstruction and hopefully significantly lowering my chances of getting cancer.After years of tireless deliberation and countless appointments with surgeons, oncologists and genetic counsellors my surgery was planned for Sept 2019.Life however decided to throw a little curveball and in May 2019 I fell pregnant with my beautiful daughter and in 2020 Covid struck, which now meant my surgery was to be postponed and rescheduled for 2022.However in hindsight this was for the best, as it has given me time to become both a mother and a full-time HGV driver (Instagram blog: PINKLADYTRUCKER_UK)of which I have represented a very PINK theme from the start.I am all for dealing with things head on and turning negatives into positives! What better way than to jump from a plane and raise money in the process?I really hope you will support my BRCA2 journey by sponsoring my Skydive for such a great cause and thank you so much for reading this far ❤Read more

title: help us give treat bunnys cancer
Description: Our precious United Yorkie Rescue Bunny has fought hard for this life.  Rescued from a puppy mill that her foster mom was able to shut down two years ago. She was diagnosed with metastatic mammary cancer and the deplorable condition of her disfigured genital areas was a horrow. We've saved her for years with a chemo drug however, recently, this precious baby girl underwent emergency surgery.  She was not herself and her foster mom could feel a mass in her tummy.   After an ultrasound, xrays and testing she was rushed for emergency surgery as her spleen was bleeding into her stomach. Her spleen was removed and 2 other masses were found and removed from her leg and sent for histopathology.  Sadly, she was diagnosed with lymphoma breaking her foster mom's heart. Her life was given a death sentence for the almighty dollar because that's what matters to these breeders.  Two days after surgery she was rushed to the ER because of severe anemia and needed an emergency transfusion.  Her little body just could not recoup on its own. Then last week, we revisited her oncologist for the final full report of her biopsies and sadly we have also acquired a Grade 3 mast cell carcinoma. We are now on a cancer pill treatment for 5 times every 3 weeks. We may have days or weeks...maybe a year...the norm is 6mths.  We are only guaranteed whatever God has in store for her but we truly have given so much to allow her to have the life that was stolen from her. Her time is now measured,  but she will continue to have the best of days.  United Yorkie Rescue truly loves these babies. IF you are giving this season, please give because of Bunny!! Her little body was so disfigured when she was rescued that you could not find or see her tail as it was inside all this sagging skin and you could not make out her rectum from her vagina...that's how horrible her abuse was!! Together we can continue to give babies like Bunny the life they were meant to have because of your kindness and love for our babies. Read more

title: anemic kitten rushed to the emergency hospital
Description: One of our recently rescued kittens, Marcel, started acting like not himself. He became lethargic, wasn't eating, and seemed to lose balance as he walked. We rushed Marcel to the vet's office only to confirm that we were right to trust our first instinct. As it turned out, Marcel had a high fever, and after we checked his blood work, we learned that he had a dangerously low red blood cell count. The vet said we have to rush Marcel to the emergency hospital because he most likely would need a blood transfusion. And so we did just that. We rushed Marcel to the emergency hospital, where the doctors are working on stabilizing him. Would you please help us save Marcel's life by donating just $1 toward his emergency bill?Read more

Description: Mark Grillo was a one of a kind selfless person. An amazing husband, father, brother, son, friend and skier. On 2/24/2020 we lost him to suicide.
