title: aidez nous financez le club du fc olemps
Description: Bonjour cette cagnotte consistera à l’entretien du stade, de la pelouse,  frais de déplacement, rachat de matériel (cage, maillot, ballons de foot), frais administratifs (assurance, comptabilité), les coûts augmentent et la billetterie et la buvette ne suffisent plus à compenser. Les dirigeants, même expérimentés, en viennent alors à se demander comment financer un club de football par les temps qui courent.Il devient alors urgent de trouver d’autres sources de revenus. L’appel à des sponsors peut être une bonne solution en démarchant les entrepreneurs de la région. Mais la mobilisation de toute une ville peut aussi donner de beaux résultats. La cagnotte pour un club de football apparaît ainsi comme la solution la plus pratique et la plus efficace.Read more

title: collecte de fonds pour lassociation sport to b
Description: Bonjour, Nous sommes 5 étudiants de l'EDHEC Business School à Roubaix.Nous avons comme projet cette année de créer une association en lien avec un des objectifs de l'ONU sur le développement durable, Santé et Bien-Être. L'objectif principal de notre projet est multiple. Nous souhaitons encourager et sensibiliser les jeunes lycéens de quartiers défavorisés à pratiquer un sport et ainsi, leur montrer les bénéfices de cette pratique sur leur santé mentale et physique. De plus, nous souhaitons démocratiser le sport pour ces derniers qui n'ont pas les moyens d'avoir accès à des équipements sportifs de qualité. L'idéal serait de voir naître de futurs talents... Enfin, notre projet permettra de favoriser la sociabilisation entre les lycéens d'établissements différents, ce qui pourrait faire diminuer le taux de violence.Nous espérons vous avoir convaincu et pouvoir récupérer le maximum de dons pour aider les plus défavorisés.Read more

title: maintenance perfectionnement et renouveau
Description: Bonjour,Je suis Nico,Je suis un professionnel du domaine aquatique, au travers de mes expériences, mes voyages et mes emplois, il m a été donné la chance de pouvoir immortaliser des moments inoubliables.Tels que le requin baleine, le requin renard, les poissons crapauds et bien d autres creatures au Philippines, les dauphins et otaries sur les cotes de la New Zealand, les temples de Thaïlande et Bali ainsi que leurs populations...Aujourd hui en France et plus particulièrement dans mon Sud Natal, j'exerce ma profession de maître nageur sauveteur au sein de l' association de Sauvetage Sportif du SSA; pas trop relax comme bien du monde penseraient...On partage et transmet notre passion pour ce monde aquatique d une manière différente.Nos jeunes et moins jeunes développent leurs aisance dans cette élément....Pendant que j immortalise leurs premières apnées , leurs premières bulles et enfin leurs premiers passages de bras.Aujourd hui ma passion pour le domaine aquatique m a emmené à investir une somme considérable ; car j utilise du matériel bien spécifique et bien souvant protégé contre l humidité afin de vous partager les meilleurs et plus insolites clichés qu il soit.Les plates-formes de partage devenant payantes, le renouvellement de matériel et les mises à jours devenant toujours plus onéreuse.J'en appelle aujourd'hui aux dons afin de pouvoir continuer à vous partager tout celaGrace a vous se sont des générations qui vont voir leur évolutions grandir au fil des années.Apres chaque don qu il soit, vous aurez des liens d'accès qui vous laisseront télécharger toutes les photos qui vous intéressent.Toujours en respectant le droit à la propriété et le droit à l image.En esperant vous avoir un peu plus concernéEt en espérant vous revoir bientôtAu plaisirNicoRead more

title: aidez alex partir en stage sportif
Description: Bonjour, je suis Alexandre Landinaff et j'ai 19 ans. Je suis un sauteur en hauteur d'origine mauricienne. Je pratique le saut en hauteur depuis maintenant un an et je nourris depuis de grandes ambitions.En effet, à court terme, je souhaites me qualifier aux Jeux des Iles de l'Océan Indien prévu en 2023 et Championnats d'Afrique 2024 (voire 2022 si j'arrive à faire les minimats à temps). Ainsi, afin d'y parvenir, je suis conscient des efforts à fournir et c'est pour celà que je donne tout ce que j'ai aux entrainements avec mon nouveau club avec qui j'ai commmencé un nouveau cycle d'entrainement il y à 2 mois : le CJF de Saint Malo.Lorsque que j'ai débuté l'athlétisme en janvier 2021, mes records était de 12.60s au 100m, +17s au 110mH et 1m80 au saut en hauteur. Depuis, mes nouveaux records sont 11.57 au 100m, 15.46s au 110mH et 1m93 au saut en hauteur. Et je suis persuadé d'avoir encore une enorme marge de progression car mon année fut ternis par une blessure de 2 mois à la mi-fevrier et un changement d'environnement en aout où je suis arrivé en France et j'ai pris du temps à prendre mes marques.Mon club à prévu un stage d'une semaine au printemps en Vendée. Malheureusement, pour des raisons financières, il me semblait impossible de pouvoir y aller, meme si ça me tenait vraiment à coeur. Puis m'est venu l'idée d'un cagnotte en ligne, et c'est pour cela que je sollicite aujourd'hui votre aide. title: KP racing 2022
Description: Kyle is a 14 years old motorcycle racer who will be competing in Europe for the 2022 season. He is pursuing the French FFM OGP (Objective GP) Championship on a Honda NSF250r and stepping up to the European Talent Cup (ETC) also on the Honda NSF250r against some of the best competition in Europe after gaining valuable experience last year in Spain in the RFME Promo3 category on a MIR Yamaha 250.Holding both UK and French nationalities, Kyle is excited to compete in France where he is currently based as well as continuing to learn from the depth of talent found in the Spanish championships.The journey so farKyle’s love for motorcycle racing began at the age of 9 when he had the opportunity to ride a mini moto at the Scott Reading M4 academy.At 10 years old, much later than most he undertook his rookie racing year on a Blata Mini Moto finishing 3rd overall taking 4 wins and 9 podiums in the British FAB championship.Graduating to a geared Metrakit Mini GP bike in 2018 he secured his first podium in his 4th race meeting and went on to be crowned British Mini GP champion in 2019 championship at the age of 12 years old with 3 race wins and 12 podiums.Since becoming British Champion the opportunity came to compete in the Spanish ESBK Championship with Cuna de Campeones aboard a Yamaha 250 powered MIR bike competing on GP style tracks around the country finishing 8th overall and with the highlight taking his maiden Podium in Jerez.A wildcard entry in September at the French circuit Pau Arnos in the French FFM moto5 championship resulted in 2 second place finishes.France FFM Objective Grand Prix ChampionshipHonda NSF 250r Kyle will run his first season in the France FFM Objective Grand Prix Championship under the French Superbike umbrella. Holding both UK and French nationalities Kyle is looking forward to competing in France where he is currently based as well as continuing to learn from the depth of talent found in the Spanish championships.CEV European Talent Cup Championship Honda NSF 250rThe CEV European Talent Cup Championship is a widely followed feeder class for talented riders on the road to MotoGP. Kyle takes the major step to compete with the world’s best riders between the ages of 14-17 in 2022.LUCKY 25 CLUB250 Euros25 lucky people will have the opportunity to be entered into our 25 club, the lucky winner drawn at random each round will receive:Company logo on bike tail unit for the race weekend1 x Complimentary Team wear (T-shirt, hat and hoodie)Signed action picture from the round2 x Entry tickets to the event (where regulations allow)Strong promotion on Kyle’s social media platformsRACE WEEKEND SPONSORSHIPFSBK Race weekend Sponsorship - 1500 EurosETC Race weekend Sponsorship - 1800 EurosThe Race Weekend Sponsorship package covers the entry fee, pre-race practice sessions, race tyres for the weekend, race fuel and a mechanic.This investment gives you the opportunity to be the main sponsor for the round. The bike will run your logos as the title sponsor for the weekend and be strongly promoted across our social media channels during the build-up as well as the race weekend itself. This package includes:Mentioned as team sponsor on entry list in program1 x Complimentary Team wear (T-shirt, hat and hoodie)Logo on team wear if confirmed before end Feb 2022Logo on leathers if confirmed before end Feb 2022Signed knee sliders used during the roundSigned action photo from the weekendEntry tickets to event (where regulations allow)Any help is much appreciated to help Kyle continue this amazing journey.Read more

title: aidez steven raliser son rve sportif
Description: Bonjour, je m'appelle Steven, j'ai 28 ans et j'habite et j'ai grandi à Plaisance du Touch depuis 1998.Je pratique un sport peu connu et réputé en France, Les Fléchettes..je suis actuellement champion de Haute Garonne, Champion Occitanie et classé 5ieme joueur de France et classé comme joueur semi professionnel.Malheureusement les fléchettes ne sont pas reconnus par le gouvernement français donc toutes les dépenses sortent de nos propres poches et nous devons faire de notre mieux pour aligné travail et passion.Je suis à la recherche d'aide pour continuer ma passion et atteindre mes objectifs fixés en début d'année, notamment la participation de différent tournois sur le circuit professionnel et continuer sur le circuit européen. Pour infos une saison complète avec inscription + trajets + hébergement coûte environ 8000€.Je participe cette saison avec 5500 euros de ma poche, pour aller au bout de mes objectifs que je me suis fixé je suis à la rechercher de fonds supplémentaires. Les fonds seront utile notamment pour aider au financement des trajets et chambres d'hôtels.Je serai extrêmement reconnaissant pour toute aides, quel qu'il soit, et m'engage à honorer et faire de mon mieux pour réaliser mes rêves. Tous dons de votre part, peu importe la somme, m'aidera à atteindre mes ambitions.Vous pouvez me contacter par email, que vous pouvez trouver dans mes contacts, et je pourrais répondre à toutes vos questions.Merci à vous pour votre aide et votre confiance en moi.StevenRead more

title: help yassine to rebuild his bmx bike
Description: Hey my name is yassine i'm 18 years old, I'm  from a small city in Morocco. I've been riding bmx since 2014 and I love that, i started with heavy ass bikes with a giant sprocket and I had a lot of fun with it for 3 years, in 2017 things changed because I bought my first real bmx for 90 bucks, it was a piece of crap, but it was lighter and easier to ride.... years after years my skills were growing but my budget is always very tight( I remember using piece of tubes as grips, riding without headset, putting screws on my plastic pedals...) just to keep riding and having fun. Now that I keep progressing I can't stop breaking parts (because I have low quality and old parts ) and it handicaps me a lot. I bought some parts for a good price like my cult butter frame for 80 bucks and my federal sprocket for 15 bucks. But I really need to change my: fork (old bended salt),crancks(3 piece fitbike that comes with complet bikes(cracked)),bar(kink in 9". Too small for me),rear wheel(broken cassette driver).headset(weird noise when u do bars),grips (no more grips ^^)and pegs(not necessary).Read more

title: 800 pour des rves
Description: Je m'appelle Mathieu, j'ai 23 ans et je suis passionné de cyclisme. Comme tout grand enfant passionné de vélo, parcourir les routes du Tour de France et un véritable rêve. Chaque année le Tour de France propose une cyclosportive sur une étape mythique deux jours avant le passage des professionnels. Malheureusement les places ce sont très vite écoulées cette année et je n'ai pu obtenir mon dossard...  Je me suis alors renseigné  et j'ai cherché comment en obtenir un. Une  solution est apparue à moi. Faire un don de 750€ minimum à l'association Mécénat Chirurgie Cardiaque* et l'échange d'un dossard ! Je me suis alors dit que c'était l'occasion de faire d'une pierre deux coups avec ce don. malheureusement je suis étudiant et cela reste une grosse somme. C'est pourquoi je créer cette cagnotte. C'est l'occasion pour moi de mener une bonne action avec vous et votre soutien ! Mais ce n'est pas tout, si je tiens énormément à participer à cette épreuve c'est parce que je souhaite qu'en plus de réaliser un de mes rêves, elle permette d'aider des personnes qui en ont énormément besoin ! Cette épreuve va donc avoir principalement 2 objectifs : 1 --> Réaliser une levée de fonds qui sera reversé pour une association qui aide des personnes en situation de handicap à financer des soins de remise en forme afin d'améliorer leurs conditions de vie actuelles et reprendre goût à la vie ! Les personnes qui participeront à la cagnotte verront  leur  nom et ou prénom floqué sur le maillot porté le jour de l'épreuve s'il le souhaite !2 --> Sauver des enfants grâce aux dons envoyés à Mécénat Chirurgie Cardiaque et qu'ainsi ils puissent à leur tour réaliser leurs rêves !Merci pour votre soutien !Read more

title: transforming lives through tennis
Description: Tennis For All Uganda is a youth-led Tennis for development organization using tennis as a vehicle for positive social change in the lives of slum children in Uganda.We seek to change lives, one game at a time, through structured tennis programs, empowerment, mobilization, and education of slum children both boys and girls through tennis. To these boys and girls; we offer tennis, health education and social support.Today, we have more than 200 boys and girls coming from the slums of Kampala who come to our community tennis training center to play tennis as well as to learn other life skills that can improve on their lives both in school to improve on their school performance and their communities making them better members in their community.Our focus is the help these children to achieve their educational/career dreams through tennis and we believe that if they are given a great opportunity to get better with their tennis, they have a big chance to be awarded a tennis scholarship here in Uganda.Help us plan a future where we continue supporting children through our various support programs like community tennis outreach training program, Education support program, Health and Well-bring program and Employment empowerment program.Setting up a regular gift provides peace of mind that our projects can run throughout the year. Please donate to help provide vital items and activities our children need every month.We are looking forward to hearing from you and we believe that your support can make a great difference in a lot of young people`s lives in our tennis program.For more information about our work/activities, please visit our social media platform and website below:https://web.facebook.com/Tennis-For-All-Uganda-1646955602259868/https://www.instagram.com/tennis_forall_uganda/www.tennisforalluganda.orgRead more

title: liberiasurfclub
Description: [VERSION FRANÇAISE EN BAS DE PAGE]A SURF CLUB IN ROBERTSPORT, LIBERIA !Robertsport surfers need your help to build their Surf Club! This will facilitate access to surfing, develop the sport, and generate income for the community.The project:The Liberian government recently offered the surfers of Robertsport, represented by the Grand Cape Mount County Surf Club Association, a plot of land in front of the waves to build a surf club.This is a great opportunity for them to create a place that will bring surfers together and make surfing more accessible. It is also a way to generate income for the community by developing surf and beach related tourism by offering visitors services such as surf lessons, surfboard rentals, food and drinks.The Surf Club will be a social, sporting and economic development asset for the village.Today we are asking for your help to fund its construction.Robertsport and its surf community:Robertsport is a small fishing village located near the northern border of the country, in the Grand Cape Mount County. Like the rest of Liberia, the village has suffered from many years of civil war. Here, surfing is used as a tool for resilience, and is part of the balance of many young people’s lives.“When I surf I forget about all the problems. It's like there's never been a war or Ebola, like I don't have to worry about money or anything! I’m in the water, I’m free and I’m having a blast!” Says Morris Sherrif, an active member of the surf community.Robertsport is home to some of West Africa's most beautiful surf spots, and has world-class waves breaking pretty often. Unfortunately surfers don’t have the equipment and resources necessary to practice and progress. The lucky ones share the few boards available, which are in very poor condition. If Liberia does not yet have international champions, it is not due to potential but to the lack of means and infrastructure.The surf club:The Surf Club will be managed as a community based organization, by the members the Grand Cape Mount County Surf Club Association. It will facilitate access to surfing by making surf equipment available to those who wish to use it. The boards and material will be stored and maintained there. It will also be the ideal place to organize surf competitions.To have fun, evolve and progress, flourish, watch over each other, learn to know the Ocean and to protect it: These are benefits and values that the club members want to share and transmit through the practice of surfing.The Surf Club will offer tourists the opportunity to take surf lessons, rent equipment, have their boards repaired, or even hire a guide to explore the surrounding surf spots. It will also be possible to eat and even camp there.These sources of income are essential to the project and its sustainability. The idea, at its core, is to allow the place and the equipment to be maintained independently, then to create jobs within the community by developing the project (construction of bungalows for rent, for example). This is an important first step towards a surf and tourism based economy, which could eventually enable part of the community to meet its needs.The construction:The surf club will be made up of several elements:- Main building (approximately 37m2) which will be used for the storage of boards, retail and rental areaas well as space for the repair of boards.- Sanitary block with showers and toilets (approximately 12m2).- Hut/ shelter to eat and rest while watching the waves, sheltered from the rain or the sun !- Water tank with rainwater collection system and filtration.- Landscaping will be done so that campers can pitch their tents. They will have access to the sanitary facilities and the rest of the infrastructure present on the site.In the future, the goal is to build housing to accommodate tourists.The construction will start summer 2021. The plan is to get the main building ready for next dry season (around November).Organizations be involved in the Surf Club’s development:UNIVERSAL OUTREACH FOUNDATIONOriginally from Canada, Kent has now lived and surfed in Liberia for 14 years. He has been involved in the Robertsport surf community for many years and shows strong and regular support.He is also the executivedirector of operations for Universal Outreach, an NGO dedicated to providing people with quality educational opportunities such as scholarship, market-driven skills training programs, and entrepreneur mentoring.Through Universal Outreach, Kent will support the development of the Surf Club by overseeing the construction of infrastructure, but also by facilitating access to education and the acquisition of the needed skills to run the project.CROSS CULTURAL CARE Initial financial support to initiate the project has come from Cross Cultural Care a local Robersport, Liberia NGO providing healthcare and education development projects and programs for over a decade. For any healthcare workers or teachers interested in volunteering in a location with amazing waves, more information is available here.PROVIDE THE SLIDEProvide the Slide is a Swiss based NGO that brings surfing equipment to West Africa. Last year, Simon and Chris, the founders, sent over 140 surfboards to Liberia, Senegal and Ghana, including 35 to Robertsport!Another load of boards and gear for Robertsport is in preparation. It will aim to provide the necessary equipment for the club: surfboards, soft tops/beginner boards, leash, fins, wax, and repair equipment.WAVES FOR CHANGEThe establishment of a "Surf Therapy" program in partnership with Waves For Change is currently in discussion. Waves for Change has created a Surf Therapy program for young people living in unstable environment. It gives children skills to cope with stress, regulate behavior, build healing relationships, and make positive life choices.To know more about Liberia and its surfing community:WATER GET NO ENEMY is a 46 minutes documentary made by Arthur Bourbon and Damien Castera that highlights the first generation of surfer in Liberia. There is no more child soldiers, it's only child surfers now!You want to help communicate on this project ???DOWNLOAD PHOTOS AND VIDEOS TO SHARE HERE---------------------------------------------------------------------UN SURF CLUB À ROBERTSPORT ! ( LIBERIA )Les surfeurs de Robertsport ont besoin de votre aide pour construire leur Surf Club!Un lieu qui permettra de faciliter l’accès au surf, d’en développer la pratique, ainsi que de générer des revenus pour la communauté.Le projet:Le gouvernement Libérien a récemment offert aux surfeurs de Robertsport, représentés par la Grand Cape Mount County Surf Club Association, un terrain en face des vagues afin qu’ils y construisent un club de surf.C’est l’occasion rêvée pour eux de créer un lieu qui permettra de fédérer les surfeurs et surfeuses autour de leur passion commune, de développer cette pratique et de faire bénéficier au plus grand nombre des ses bienfaits physiques et mentales. C’est aussi l’opportunité de générer des revenus pour la communauté en développant le tourisme lié au surf et la plage, en proposant au visiteurs de nombreux services tel que l’apprentissage du surf et la location de matériel, ou encore de la restauration.Le Surf Club sera un acteur de développement social, sportif et économique pour le village.Aujourd’hui nous sollicitons donc votre aide afin de financer sa construction !Robersport et ses surfeurs:Robertsport est un petit village de pêcheur situé à la frontière Nord du pays, dans le Grand Cape Mount County. Comme le reste du Liberia, le village a souffert des nombreuses années de guerre civile. Ici, le surf est utilisé comme exutoire, comme outil de résilience, et fait parti de l’équilibre de nombreux jeunes surfeurs et surfeuses.«Quand je surf j’oublie tous les problèmes. C’est comme si il n’y avait jamais eu de guerre ou Ébola, comme si je n’avais plus de soucis d’argent ou quoi que ce soit! Je suis dans l’eau, je me sens libre et je m’éclate!» témoigne Morris Sherrif, membre actif de la communauté surf.Robertsport abrite parmi les plus beaux spots d’Afrique de l’Ouest, et des vagues de classe mondiale y déferlent. Malheureusement les surfeurs et surfeuses manquent de matériel et de ressources pour pouvoir pratiquer et progresser. Les plus chanceux se partagent les quelques planches disponibles, souvent en très mauvais état. Si le Liberia ne compte pas encore de champions internationaux ce n’est pas à cause du potentiel local mais bien du manque de moyens et d’infrastructures.Le surf club:Le Surf Club sera géré de manière associative par les membres du Grand Cape Mount County Surf Club Association.Il permettra de faciliter l’accès à la pratique du surf en mettant à disposition du materiel et en initiant ceux qui le souhaite. Les planches et le matériel y seront entreposés et entretenus.Cela sera également le lieu idéal pour organiser des compétitions de surf !S’amuser, évoluer et progresser, s’épanouir, veillez les uns sur les autres, apprendre à connaitre l’Ocean et à le protéger: des bienfaits et des valeurs que souhaitent partager et transmettre les membres du club grace à la pratique du surf.Le Surf Club offrira l’opportunité aux touristes de prendre des cours de surf, de louer du matériel et de faire réparer leurs planches, ou encore de faire appel aux services d’un guide pour découvrir les spots de surf environnants. Il sera également possible de s’y restaurer et même d’y camper!Ces sources de revenus sont primordiales au projet et à sa pérennité. L’idée est, dans un premier temps, de permettre d’entretenir le lieu et le matériel de manière indépendante, puis de créer des emplois au sein de la communauté et de développer le projet (construction de bungalows à louer par exemple). C’est un premier pas important vers une économie tournée vers le surf, qui pourrait par la suite permettre à une partie de la communauté de subvenir à ses besoin.La construction:Le surf club sera constitué de plusieurs éléments:- un bâtiment principal (environ 37m2) qui servira en autre à l’entreposage des planches et du materiel ainsi qu’à la réparation de planches.un bloc sanitaire avec douches et WC (environ 12m2)- une hutte / abri pour se restaurer et se reposer en regardant les vagues, l’abri de la pluie ou du soleil!- une cuve / reservoir d’eau surélevée avec système de récupération d’eau de pluie et filtration.- le terrassement du terrain sera effectué de sorte à ce que des campeurs puissent y planter leurs tentes. Ils auront accès aux sanitaires et au restes des infrastructures présentent sur le site.À moyen terme, le but est de construire des logements pour pouvoir accueillir les touristes.Ils sont impliqués dans le développement du Surf Club:Universal Outreach FoundationD’origine Canadienne, Kent habite et surf au Liberia depuis maintenant 14 ans. Il est impliqué depuis de nombreuses années dans la communauté surf de Robertsport et y apporte un soutient régulier.Il est aussi directeur des opérations pour Universal Outreach, une ONG qui oeuvre pour l’accès à l’éducation et la professionnalisation, ainsi qu’au développement d’initiatives économiques au Liberia.Par le biais de Universal Outreach, Kent accompagnera le développement de Surf Club en supervisant la construction des infrastructures, mais aussi en facilitant l’accès à l’éducation et à l’acquisition des compétences nécessaire à la gestion du projet.CROSS CULTURAL CARECross Cultural Care est une association médicale humanitaire qui porte assistance aux habitants du Grand Cap Mount County. L'ONG oeuvre également pour le développement et l'accès à l'éducation. Basée à Robertsport, elle s'implique dans le projet de surf club en participant au financement de sa construction. Cette première donation permettra de débuter les travaux très prochainement.Si vous êtes enseignants ou faites parties du corps médical et souhaitez participez à une mission humanitaire dans un endroit avec de belles vagues, vous trouverez plus de renseignements ici!Provide The SlideProvide the Slide est une jeune association Suisse qui achemine du materiel de surf en Afrique de l’Ouest. L’an dernier, Simon et Chris, les fondateurs, ont envoyé plus de 140 planches au Liberia, au Sénégal et au Ghana, dont 35 à Robertsport!Un autre convoyage vers Robertsport est en cours de préparation. Il aura pour but d’apporter le matériel nécessaire à l’activité du club: planches de surf, planches «école» en mousse, leash, dérives, wax, materiel de réparation…Waves For ChangeLa mise en place d’un programme de «Surf Thérapie» en partenariat avec l’association Waves For Change est en cours discussion.Waves for Change a créé un programme de Surf Therapy pour les jeunes vivant dans des environnements instables, voir dangereux. W4C donne aux enfants les compétences nécessaires pour faire face au stress, réguler le comportement, établir des relations de guérison et faire des choix de vie positifs.Envie de nous aider à communiquer sur ce projet ???Téléchargez des photos et des vidéos à partager ICIRead more

title: skatepark diy standr marseille
Description: Bonjour à toutes et à tous,Fondée en 1970, St-André Loisirs et Culture, SALC, est l’une des associations les plus vieilles de France accueillant du skateboard.Après tous les skateurs et toutes ses années passées, le skatepark intérieur est devenu vétuste. C’est pour cela que l’on a besoin de vous!Située en périphérie de Marseille et dans un quartier défavorisé, SALC a vu passer plusieurs associations de skate comme Formula Prod, BSM et aujourd’hui nous, l’ASVM.Notre objectif est de rénover ce skatepark pour continuer à proposer des cours de skate dans ces quartiers. Pour que le projet voit le jour, nous avons besoin de votre participation pour l’achat de matériel et matériaux.En retour, des sessions privées seront organisées pour que vous puissiez profiter du nouveau skateparkDIY (N’oubliez pas de bien mentionner votre nom et prénom).Nous aurons aussi besoin de mains pour les travaux. Pour cela, vous pouvez nous contacter via notre Instagram ici, ou par mail à [email redacted]Nous souhaitons que les travaux démarrent en Septembre afin que le projet soit achevé avant ou peu après la reprise de nos cours, et qu’il soit disponible avant l'arrivée de l'hiver. Merci d’avance pour votre participation et votre intérêt pour ce projet qui nous tient à cœur.Et merci à Lauris Gouiran, de Constructo, pour nous avoir fournis ces plans et son temps.Read more

title: homenaje deportivo a elis cegarra chapuln
Description: Los fondos estarán destinados a la recuperación de una cancha deportiva ubicada en la Urb Campo de Oro en la ciudad de Mérida, Venezuela. Los trabajos constan de tres etapas que serán dirigidas por el Ing Civil egresado de la Universidad de los Andes (ULA), Rafael Carrillo, junto a la comunidad de vecinos.Etapa 1: Reparación y remplazo del sistema eléctrico.Etapa 2 : Pintura y reparación de algunas zonas deterioradas de la cancha deportiva.Etapa 3: Compra de material deportivo y organización de un campeonato de futbol para niños en el mes de diciembre 2021. ( I Campeonato INFANTIL de futbolín interurbano, Copa Elis Cegarra "Chapulín")Quién fue Elis Cegarra?Elis Cegarra fue un atleta de Tenis de mesa nacido en Mérida, el 10 de Noviembre del año 74 y que murió el 4 de julio de 1995 en un trágico accidente automovilístico en los Estados Unidos, cuando junto a otros 6 atletas se disponían a representar a Venezuela en el abierto de los Estados unidos de Tenis de mesa.A continuación destacar su curriculum deportivo.En su curriculum figura: Integrante de la selección de Mérida a los juegos Deportivos de Barcelona estado Anzoátegui en 1990. Medalla de oro en los Juegos Nacionales Universitarios (JUVINES 94) celebrados en Mérida, Medalla de plata en dobles masculino en el Campeonato Nacional Universitario realizado en la USB y ganador del cupo para la selección Venezuela.Es un homenaje póstumo que queremos hacer con la ayuda de todos a: Elis Cegarra "Chapulín"A continuación, en este video usted podrá ver la entrevista que se hizo algunos días antes de su muerte.Traduction en français﻿Les fonds seront utilisés pour la récupération d'un terrain de sport situé à Urb Campo de Oro dans la ville de Mérida, au Venezuela. Les travaux consistent en trois étapes qui seront dirigées par l'ingénieur civil Rafael Carrillo, diplômé de l'Universidad de los Andes (ULA), en collaboration avec la communauté de voisins.Étape 1 : Réparation et remplacement du système électrique.Étape 2 : Peinture et réparation de certaines zones détériorées du terrain de sport.Étape 3 : Achat d'équipements sportifs et organisation d'un championnat de football pour les enfants en décembre 2021. (I Championnat de football de table inter-villes des enfants, Coupe Elis Cegarra "Chapulín").Qui était Elis Cegarra ?Elis Cegarra était un athlète de tennis de table né à Mérida, le 10 novembre 1974 et décédé le 4 juillet 1995 dans un tragique accident de voiture aux États-Unis, alors qu'il s'apprêtait à représenter le Venezuela avec 6 autres athlètes lors de l'Open de tennis de table des États-Unis.Voici son curriculum vitae sportif.Son curriculum comprend : Membre de l'équipe nationale de Mérida aux Jeux sportifs de Barcelone dans l'État d'Anzoátegui en 1990. Médaille d'or aux Jeux nationaux universitaires (JUVINES 94) qui se sont déroulés à Mérida, médaille d'argent en double hommes au Championnat national universitaire qui s'est tenu à l'USB et gagnant du quota pour l'équipe nationale vénézuélienne.C'est un hommage posthume que nous voulons réaliser avec l'aide de vous tous : Elis Cegarra "Chapulin".Dans cette vidéo, vous pourrez voir l'interview qui a été réalisée quelques jours avant sa mort.Traduit avec www.DeepL.com/Translator (version gratuite)En las siguientes imagenes usted encontrara los tres presupuestos para llevar a cabo los trabajos.-Presupuesto del sistema eléctrico,-Presupuesto de la pintura-Presupuesto para el material deportivoEl ingeniero civil encargado de los trabajos sera el Sr. Rafael CARRILLOhttps://www.linkedin.com/in/rafael-carrillo-23995131/#Dans les images suivantes vous trouverez les trois devis pour réaliser les travaux.-Devis pour le système électrique,-Devis pour la peinture-Devis pour les équipements sportifsL'ingénieur civil en charge des travaux sera M. Rafael CARRILLOhttps://www.linkedin.com/in/rafael-carrillo-23995131/#Read more

title: yccab financement dun centre sportif mwanzatanzanie
Description: Ayant étant victime d'une erreur, tous les fonds collectés ont été reversés aux donateurs. Je recrée donc cette cagnotte afin de vous relancer, donateurs, et de pouvoir faire partie du projet!Anciennement volontaire au sein de la Sports Charity Mwanza pour plus de 5 mois grâce à la Sports Management School, je lance cet appel afin de contribuer à l'un des objectifs de la Charity.Fondé en 2016, cet organisme de bienfaisance favorise l’expansion des quatre sports d’équipe les plus populaires dans le pays (football, volleyball, basketball et netball). La SC Mwanza permet ainsi l’accès au sport à de nombreux filles et garçons de la région de Mwanza (4 millions d’habitants).· Elle construit et exploite ses centres sportifs et communautaires, ce qui crée une infrastructure sportive dans les zones métropolitaines de la région de Mwanza, qui est utilisée par les écoles le matin et les clubs l’après-midi.· Elle soutient la création de clubs sportifs avec des équipes de jeunes et de plus anciens. En proche collaboration avec les instances sportives locales, elle soutient la mise en place de structures et la formation des entraîneurs. Aussi, elle fournit à chaque club 5 à 10 ballons afin d’assurer la mise en place d’entraînements structurés. Après avoir construit les centres de Mirongo et SabaSaba en collaboration avec l’administration et les associations sportives, nous voulons nous lancer dans le 3ème projet : Mabatini. Celui-ci permettra aux habitants de pratiquer au plus près de chez eux, en développant de nouvelles capacités, de nouvelles relations et en pouvant s'amuser au fil des semaines.Il sera utilisé par les écoles durant la journée et par les clubs le soir et les weekends.Pour cela, la Charity a besoin de financement, car la construction du complexe coûte 70 000 euros, d'où cette levée de fond en collaboration avec la Sports Management School!Chaque euro est important, pour construire ce nouveau lieu sportif, convivial et ouvert à tous.On compte sur vous!Enzo Ceccaldi - Sports Charity MwanzaRead more

title: help victoria scottlegendre get to tokyo olympics
Description: Hello,My name is Vicky Scott-Legendre. It is a dream come true that I will be competing at the Tokyo Olympics this year! I will be representing South Africa in Equestrian- Eventing, with my horse Valtho des Peupliers.It has been a very long road to get this far! This years Games will be unusual, as it is closed and with no outside spectators.  Luckily I will have the support of my team- Rodolphe Scherer (coach), Charlotte Cremieux (groom), Ingeborg Sanne (chef d'equipe) and Colin Scott (father).I am very grateful for my sports and equestrian federations for funding so much of the costs involved in such an operation. However, there are a lot of additional costs involved that are a big financial challenge for me (summarised later).Hence my plea for aid and funding. Any kind donation would alleviate the financial stress of these costs, and allow me to focus on my performance at the Games.My offer to the donators would be to join a personal WhatsApp group, that would allow you to follow the behind the scenes action at the Games.Thank you for your support and for sharing this funding appeal further.Travel, food and accommodation 2000eurosEquipment 1000eurosSupport team expenses 5000eurosRead more

title: support the buffs for their xiengkhouang tour
Description: TO ALL THE BUFF FAMILY AND FRIENDS OUT THERE!The Buffalettes and Buffalos are organizing the first ever national tour to Xiengkhouang and we need your support!As you may know, rugby is growing in Xiengkhouang where there is now 3 clubs with men and women teams. Because of their location, they don't see a lot of teams going up there, actually no team has ever tour to their province so the Buffs have decided to do a premiere by going up there to play on March 27th!The Buffalos and Buffalettes now have a lot of young lao players in their ranks and it will be a great opportunity for them to travel to Xiengkhouang to play some rugby. We are lucky to still be able to play rugby in Laos due to the low numbers of covid cases within the country but the pandemic has impacted the economy of the country and this is why we are calling for your support! This fundraising is exclusively organized to support our lao players who can't afford such expenses. We hope you can help us, it doesn't have to be a lot, every kip counts and would mean a lot to our teams.By supporting us you would make possible:- The travel of 20 Lao players from Vientiane to Phonsavan by minivan,- Accommodation for 20 lao players for 2 nights,- Food allowance for 20 lao players during 3 days,- Renting of the pitch in Phonsavan for half day to host games for more than 50 lao players from different teams,From all the Buffalettes and Buffalos,Khopchai lai lai,Thank you very much!Read more

title: sauvetage ecuries de roquebre
Description: Parce que les Ecuries de Roquebère ne sont pas un simple centre équestre,Parce que nous vous accueillons toujours dans une ambiance familiale,Parce que nous vous acceptons comme vous êtes et avec vos différences,Parce que nous savons écouter lorsque nos cavaliers ne vont pas bien personnellement, psychologiquement, socialement,Parce que pour beaucoup nous sommes leur repère ou leur bouée de sauvetage.Aujourd'hui, nous avons besoin de vous.....Les Ecuries de Roquebère, c'est l'aventure d'une jeune femme qui se lance seule en 2009 à seulement 24 ans dans une aventure de passion et le rêve de toute une vie.Chaque jour, nous avons le plaisir d'accueillir nos cavaliers dans une ambiance familiale lors de cours d'équitation classique ou de concours. Nous accueillons également leur compagnon en pension et avons le plaisir de faire naître nos poulains.La particularité des Ecuries de Roquebère, c'est l'écoute. Avoir une oreille attentive pour chacun et chacune, en effet, le cheval est un merveilleux moyen de communication et de médiation. Mais au delà, nous consacrons un temps important lorsque nos élèves sont en souffrance. Que se soit psychologiquement ou personnellement, un grand nombre de nos cavaliers rencontrent des soucis et trouvent auprès de nous une oreille attentive, des conseils ou du réconfort. Pour beaucoup nous sommes une bouée de sauvetage, un repère.Après 10 ans d'ouverture, c'est le rêve de toute une vie, la bouée de sauvetage de certains, le repère pour d'autres qui est mis en péril.Les propriétaires des terres et bâtiments que nous exploitons ont décidé de vendre pour des raisons financières et de santé. Le repreneur qui à la base souhaitait maintenir l'activité équestre sur le site vient de nous annoncer qu'au final il ne le ferait plus.Cette vente entraînerait la fermeture des Ecuries de Roquebère. Au delà de ça, c'est l'ensemble des projets que nous souhaitions développer qui sont remis en question, parmi lesquels l'accueils de jeunes en difficulté ou en séjour de rupture.Aujourd'hui, nous n'avons pas la capacité financière de pouvoir racheter ce domaine. Nous devons aller très vite, en effet, nous devons nous positionner dans les semaines à venir pour pouvoir acquérir le domaine . C'est pourquoi nous nous tournons vers vous pour continuer cette aventure. Pouvoir continuer a accueillir les cavaliers, leur apporter l'écoute nécessaire dont ils ont besoin, accueillir des jeunes en difficultés.En cette période de crise sanitaire que nous rencontrons, plus que jamais l'écoute et l'accueil de publics en difficulté est nécessaire. L'équitation leur permet de s'aérer l'esprit et de reprendre confiance en eux.Aidez nous, aidez les, participez à cette belle aventure à nos cotés.La présentation vidéo qui est faite est le reflet de nos écuries et de son ambiance familiale, elle a été réalisée par nos cavaliers en toute discrétion. Ils nous l'on offerte pour faire connaitre leur centre équestre.Site des Ecuries de RoquebèreRead more

title: doneaza pentru amenajarea teren de sport
Description: Stimați prieteni, dragi băștinași ai satului Corjeuți. Împreună cu Dumneavoastră, am realizat deja multe lucruri frumoase pentru localitatea noastră. Pe această cale, vă aducem sincere mulțumiri pentru susținerea proiectelor și inițiativelor noastre.Mulți din Dvs. cunoașteți că Asociația Obștească "Corjeuțenii de Pretutindeni" a cîștigat primul său proiect și anume - "Amenajarea unui mini-teren cu instalații de sport în aer liber", amplasat în parcul de lîngă Casa de Cultură și Gimnaziu Corjeuți.Proiectul are 2 obiective:crearea unei zone de recreere și reabilitare pentru locuitori;oferirea unei oportunități alternative elevilor Gimnaziului Corjeuți pentru a desfășura unele lecții de educație fizică într-o manieră interactivă, așa cum elevii nu au nici sală de sport adecvată, nici teren sportiv.⚡️Este un prim proiect cu o valoarea simbolică de $1000 pentru a verifica capacitatea noastră de mobilizare și lucru în echipă. Pentru următoarea etapă PNUD oferă suma de $ 20 000.⚡️ Pe lîngă suma de $1000 oferită de finanțatori, localitatea trebuie să vină cu încă $ 2 000.Haideți să demonstrăm că ne pasă de satul în care ne-am născut! Haideți să demonstrăm că putem ajuta cu o sumă simbolică pentru infrastructura satului nostru.Data limită: 11 septembrie 2021Vă MULȚUMIM ANTICIPATRead more

title: zf3gh 3me centre sportif pour mwanza
Description: Objectif : 3ème centre sportif de la Sports Charity MwanzaChers amis,Comme beaucoup d'entre vous le savent, je suis actuellement volontaire pour la Sports Charity Mwanza, un projet de sport et de développement à but non lucratif fondé en 2016. Cet organisme favorise l'expansion des 4 sports d'équipe les plus populaires dans le pays (football, volleyball, basketball et netball). Nous procurons ainsi à de nombreux filles et garçons l'accès aux sports de club en Tanzanie.Ce que nous faisons avec votre don :En collaboration avec l'administration régionale et les associations sportives locales, nous construisons une infrastructure de sports et de clubs dans la région de Mwanza (environ 3 millions d'habitants). Ces infrastructures comprenant un terrain de football, de basketball, de volleyball et de netball, sont utilisées par les écoles le matin et les clubs l’après-midi. Les deux premiers centres sportifs que l'ONG a construit durant les 4 dernières années ont montré un franc succès. C’est pourquoi nous aimerions construire un 3ème centre dans le quartier de Mabatini. Pour cela, nous avons besoin de 70 000 €. Alors chacun de vos dons peut faire la différence, je compte sur vous !Je me réjouis de vous voir nombreux à participer. Rien de tout cela ne serait possible sans votre précieux soutien.LouRead more

title: to become an ironman finisher
Description: English version belowLa version française suit*English version*Dear Family, Friends, and Loved Ones,Becoming an IRONMAN®FINISHER would mean the world to me as it would prove that anyone can CONQUER THE CAN’T. And I would love your help to get me across the finish line and achieve my dream of completing the full Ironmanrace in Vichy, France, in August 2022.You might ask yourselves “What the heck is he talking about? An Ironman?? Never heard of it”. Allow me to answer your question: An Ironman is a triathlon race. Except, unlike a regular triathlon, a full Ironman is a 140.6 mile journey. Starting with a 2.4 MILE SWIM (3.86km), I will then get out of the water and hop onto my BICYCLE FOR 112 MILES (180.25 km), to eventually slip on my running shoes and complete a MARATHON (26.22 MILE, 42.20km). This race takes place from dawn at 7 am to dusk at 11 pm for a period of 16 hours.Now grasping the full magnitude of such a race, you might wonder “Why in the world would anyone attempt this race? Is he crazy??” Maybe I am crazy. But in any case, please allow me to share my story and how I came about this decision to attempt such an EXCITING challenge.When I was younger, I was not a model student. In fact, my grades were so appalling that the principal of my school, and several of my teachers suggested I quit and redo my year. To add on to that, classmates, knowing of my predicament, picked on me and bullied me. By that point, I was at the bottom of the barrel.This all changed however, when later that year I joined the Karate club and met an extraordinary teacher (sensei): Philippe Pivert. For the first time in my life, someone, outside of my family circle, believed in me. Sadly, my sensei passed away in 2016. However, a few years later, buoyed by his ironclad support, I PASSED my blackbelt exam.I refused to stop there. I KEPT ON GOING. Last semester, I graduated with a BA from McGill University, a top Canadian university. This year, after an arduous selection process that pitted me against bright and motivated students, I was accepted to ESCP Business school, a top French Business school. Today, I have committed myself to do an Ironman because I want to show that no matter how much people pull you down, you alone decide who you want to become.That’s where YOU come in! I need to raise at least $850 USD with a stretch goal of $1500 USD for the Ironman in order to complete my registration.In return for your generous encouragements and/or donations, I'll keep you up to date regarding my training.I want to thank you in advance for supporting me in this journey and any donation, pecuniary or otherwise, however small, will go a long way to achieving my dream.Thank you again so much for your consideration.SEE YOU AT THE FINISH LINE!!Axel*Version française*Chère famille, chers amis,Je nourris le projet « fou » de devenir un IRONMAN® FINISHER. Il s’agit pour moi de prouver que nous pouvons tous accomplir nos rêves. Et j’aimerais que vous m’aidiez à franchir la ligne d’arrivée et à réaliser mon projet qui est de terminer le « full Ironman » (Ironman complet) à Vichy, en France, en août 2022.Vous pourriez vous demander « De quoi diable parle-t-il ? Un Ironman ? Je n’en ai jamais entendu parler ». Permettez-moi de répondre à votre question : un Ironman est une course d’endurance et plus particulièrement un triathlon. Mais, contrairement à un triathlon normal, un full Ironman est une épopée de 226.2 km. En commençant par une NAGE en eaux vives de 3,86 km, j’enfourcherai ensuite mon VÉLO pendant 180.25 km et enfilerai enfin mes tennis pour courir un MARATHON (42,20 km). Cette épreuve se déroule de l’aube au crépuscule pendant une durée totale de 16 heures.Prenant conscience de l’ampleur d’une telle épreuve, vous vous demandez peut-être « Pourquoi donc tenterait-il cette course ? Est-il fou ? » Fou ? Peut-être bien ! Permettez-moi de partager avec vous mon histoire et comment je suis arrivé à cette décision de tenter ce défi passionnant. Lorsque j’étais plus jeune, je n’étais pas un élève modèle. En fait, mes notes étaient si épouvantables que le proviseur de mon école et plusieurs de mes enseignants ont suggéré que je redouble ou que je m’oriente vers une section professionelle. En plus de cela, des camarades de classe, conscients de ma situation, se sont attaqués à moi et m’ont intimidé. À ce moment-là, « j’ai touché le fond ».Tout a changé cependant, quand plus tard, cette année-là, j’ai rejoint le club de Karaté et ai rencontré un professeur de karaté (sensei) extraordinaire : Philippe Pivert. Pour la première fois de ma vie, quelqu’un, en dehors de ma famille, a cru en moi. Malheureusement, mon sensei est décédé en 2016. Mais, quelques années plus tard, envigoré par son soutien inébranlable et par les professeurs du club, j’ai obtenu ma ceinture noire de karaté (vous pouvez consulter la photo en bas de page )J’ai refusé de m’arrêter là, cependant. J’ai continué. L’année dernière, j’ai obtenu une licence en Sciences Politiques et Gestion à la prestigieuse Université de McGill (Canada). Cette année, après un processus de sélection exigeant qui m’a confronté à des étudiants brillants et motivés, j’ai été admis à l’ESCP Business school, l’une des meilleures écoles de commerce francaise. Aujourd’hui, je me suis engagé à faire un Ironman parce que je suis convaincu que seul, nous décidons qui nous souhaitons devenir.VOUS pouvez m’aider à realiser ce beau projet ! Vous pouvez m’encourager : par un texto ou via un don pour financer mon inscription dont le montant est de 700 € avec un objectif total de 1000 € pour financer une partie de mon équipement (vélo de route, combinaison, montre GPS…). Je serai heureux de vous tenir au courant de l’évolution de mon entrainement par le biais de photos, vidéos, anecdotes que je posterai sur un compte instagram que je vais créer d’ici peu.Je tiens à vous remercier d’avance de me soutenir dans ce « voyage » et tout don, aussi petit soit-il, tous vos encouragements contribueront grandement à la réalisation de mon rêve.Merci mille fois pour votre attention.RENDEZ-VOUS SUR LA LIGNE D’ARRIVÉE !!AxelRead more

title: help refugee and at risk kids play soccer
Description: On a cool crisp Sunday I sit next to my sister, niece, and nephew’s gravestone as the leaves paint a backdrop trinity of yellow, orange, and green as my dreams hover like lost leaves clutching to a branch now too cold to let it stay.It’s my sister’s birthday today, and on her birthday I am trying to figure out a way to merge soccer and music to honor her, and to benefit the refugee and at-risk students I coach and work with. I knew being closer to her and the kids would allow me to figure out the best way to forge ahead.This year Tricia would have turned 48. In the past birthdays, and anniversary’s were always brutal for me-her youngest brother Patrick. In those days, when depression clung to my neck like two chains of sorrow and sadness, I always dreaded fall coming. In the past it was just the culmination of all my fears, repressed emotions, and the boiling cauldron of hate I kept bubbling in a dungeon locked in my belly over their murders. I ran from fall for over fifteen years, and then fate intervened this year and I became a soccer coach and everything changed.Now mind you when I first signed up to coach I had no clue what I was doing, getting into, or that it would spark this idea to help these kids. I became a coach because the middle school I work at was in desperate need for coaches so I jumped in. My experience with soccer ended in 6th grade, and It wasn’t a sport I watched or even was any good at playing. I had no connection to it so going into my first practice of tryouts I figured I’d just get my Ted Lasso on, and let the power of positivity propel me. For the record I have never watched that show- and my coaching style definitely runs the gamut of emotions from Bobby Knight to Nick Sabin to Pete Carroll.As my loyal readers from brokenresolutions.com know I learn best from jumping right in- usually failing at first- and then finally excelling. I mean I failed at making Mac n cheese once when I was babysitting for Tricia and making food for my tattletale niece Gillian. She wanted microwaveable macaroni and cheese- which to most people is very easy to whip-up. Yet I was a jabroni and forget to put water in the bowl for the macaroni. Yes, at nineteen years old I screwed up making microwavable mac and cheese, which I think is nearly impossible, and yet I managed to ace that test. So I ended up burning the noodles and making the house smell awful like cabbage water that has been left on the dashboard of a car in the middle of July for weeks. As soon as my sister came home Gillian sauntered right up to her and sold me out, “Uncle Patrick made the house smell.”When I was real young I was really close to Tricia, but as I got into my teens we would always fight. I knew how to terrorize and push her buttons. I perfected the annoying little brother role so well that one afternoon while watching MTV’s The Grind she got so enraged at me she broke the TV remote controller by chucking it at my head. Luckily, I ducked. But after she had Gillian all that changed and I become the go to baby-sitter, and was no longer the ten year old terror looking to torment my nineteen year old sister. Yet she did get her revenge because this team to most was a terror- on the field and off.This is how my season started via posts on Facebook:9/18: I am not saying I am the greatest soccer coach in the world- but my team is undefeated after our first game. After a dominant 2-0 pre-season- including a thrilling 2-1 win over a very physical and aggressive girls B team- we are now poised for a championship run.9/25: Still undefeated as a coach after 10-0 and 8-1 victories on the pitch. I am not saying I am John Wooden yet…but there are some people saying loudly on the internet I might be the greatest Middle School B Team 2 coach in recent history. I mean I am humble as they come- but the internet doesn’t lie.Our first game was on the road versus Windham Summit. On the bus the kids were blaring and losing their minds to Cocomelon- a YouTube kid’s show where this cartoon Cailui looking like family just redoes nursery rhymes and popular kids songs. When I was in sixth grade I was getting into trouble because my friends put on a mixtape I made during gym class and the lady gym teacher was not as impressed as I was that the Wu Tang Clan was nothing to f@ck with. However the power of cartoon positivity did the trick to fire up the squad and we won 7-5.Tricia also had horrible taste in music. Like, brutally bad. In her car she would play really cheesy Euro techno. The stuff you hear in 90’s aerobic classes-which was fitting since she was a personal trainer and was always in ridiculously good shape. Things that were not in as good shape though were my ears as this dreck pulsated them- however James and Gillian loved it- vibrating and bouncing up and down in their car seats with huge grins plastered on their faces. My sister also loved Barry Manillowe, and even went to see him in concert. Before she passed she was going back to school to get a nursing degree. She had always wanted to be either a nurse, or a school teacher. She really would been great at either since she was such an amazing mom, and person.Speaking of amazing my team had the leading goal scorer in the league- a charming sixth grader from the Congo with immense talent that should had been on the A team had he tried out. In our first game he scored five of our 7 goals, whiles assisting on the other two. Luckily I worked with him during camp this summer and found out he was a ringer and snatched him up fast. You will learn in coaching that a talented player can make your life a lot easier by covering up any defects your team or you as a coach may have. And believe me I had and still have plenty of defects when it comes to coaching- but I think my ability to connect with players, and my Bill Belichick like love of history and strategy has me ever improving.Things we also led the league in was getting yelled at by the referees for swearing, players being sent to PPR(where you get sent when you get kicked out of class),being in ISS( internal suspension), and coaches with red cards. Think a sober middle school version of the 1986 NY Mets meets Bad News Bears. I relate well to the kids that get into trouble a lot, and I made that abundantly clear a couple days after the dreaded anniversary of their deaths when I received a red card versus our top rival Quaker in a showdown for first place.The first time we played Quaker we lost 7-3- it was our first loss and first time we had trailed in any game. My team fell apart as soon as we went down- arguing with the refs and themselves. We stopped hustling to plays and played abysmal team soccer. We had faced adversity and failed our first test, and I was determined that would be the last time this happened.The rematch for first place was set for October 4th- but this year my brain was not locked into a cycle of despair over that previous horrible day- but rather in a YouTube k-hole of soccer formations and false 9 videos trying to figure out the best line-up and game plan to defeat Quaker.The God’s of rain pushed the game back to Wednesday, and the rematch was an epic back and forth match. We scored early in the first half- but immediately gave up a goal right back to them as they tied it up one to one. Quaker was able to sneak another goal in late and we ended up losing 2-1.Reflection made me realize that I was definitely more emotional and hyped up then usual for this game- first I really wanted my players to realize they were the better team and could beat them if they just played together. Also I think it was definitely a release for me embracing my new normal. One of the strangest feelings I think for those that dealt with anything that took away their spark for life, and had them living by a nightlight is how to live life with out the comforter of depression. For those blessed with never dealing with depression, or any debilitating mental health ailment, tragedy, or setback that destroyed your whole world view- this might seem like a very foreign concept. But when happiness has alluded you, either by circumstance, bad brain chemistry, or a combination of both, living a life without it can be terrifying to embrace. So when your biggest pressing worry is a B league middle school soccer game life is going pretty good.But if you listened to a supposedly “concerned” Quaker parent my red card exit occurred after I had cursed out my players, then the refs- then like I was cosplaying 2Pac exited the field with both middle fingers in the air. I wish I was making this up- but they sent this to my athletic director and principal. Obviously they knew this Shaker mom was full of malarkey-but my AD, who is a really talented and successful coach, needed to bring it to my attention because of perception. Just getting a red card gives me a target on my back. It doesn’t help I am extremely loud, and animated on the sidelines- I pace a couple miles each game- but I never would yell or curse out a kid. I do loudly praise them for their hard work on the field- but I am also not changing my whole style cause some rich asshole doesn’t like me or my team- but I will definitely keep myself more in check from now on because I understand- regardless of reality- I need to be even more careful about my actions because people like that will prey upon it. Also I need to not be so damn stupid next time a situation like this occurs. I got thrown out arguing subbing rules during throw ins. I finally lost it when the ref let their team sub on our thrown in- and then the next play they had a throw in, and I had a sub waiting and I asked, “So can I illegally sub now,” and he goes no- and my last words were, “So I guess we are the only team that has to play by the rules now.”But the perception of me, and my team that Quaker parent had on me motivated me to realize how I could honor my loved ones by giving kids a chance to play indoor soccer come November and the winter months. A lot of the kids I work with deal with negative perceptions that are not their fault. Having options like this to learn and grow at a sport- while also bonding with and forming life long friendships with teammates is huge in a child’s development, and the perceptions others may have of them. Indoor soccer costs can be exorbitant- so that’s why I am trying to keep costs low for the families- and free for those that can’t afford it.And that’s where you my loyal readers come in. Do you want to stick it to a bunch of rich private school snobs? Do you want to help refugee and at risk kids? Do you want to be able to find out if we won the championship in the B league, and have exclusive reports on how we are doing during the indoor season? Well I got a chance for you to donate to help the cause and be like the Wu Tang clan and be there for the kids. The idea is hopefully we can raise enough money to ensure price is not a barrier for any player, and also help make sure their uniform and equipment costs are covered. Ideally we are looking to raise $2,000 and use this soccer adventure as a real life example of what a non profit dedicated to my sister, niece, and nephew would be able to achieve.Thank you for taking the time to read this and any donation large or small is extremely appreciated.Also GoFundMe needs me to state that no raffles, sweepstakes, giveaways, or returns on investment are offered in exchange for any donations made to your GoFundMe.Sincerely,Patrick BernardRead more

title: padraig pearses senior footballers fundraiser
Description: Dreams do come true!Padraig Pearses Senior Footballers, County & Connacht Champions has a real nice ring to it! Massive credit and congratulations to the players and management on this historic achievement.We are not finished yet and have an All Ireland Semi Final versus Kilmacud Crokes on Saturday 29th January. As you can imagine, this wonderful achievement comes at a cost to the Club, on top of the financial challenges to continue to invest in all our teams and improve our facilitiesDue to the current pandemic it is extremely challenging to hold fundraising events especially with the constraints of bringing people together.We would appreciate it so much, if you could help us by making a donation towards the Senior FootballersWe are really thankful again for all your ongoing support.We look forward to bringing more success to the Club and seeing you all on the 29th January to cheer on our heroesIf you wish to donate/contribute outside of this GoFundMe, please contact our Club Treasurer Ciaran McGreal directly on [phone redacted]On behalf of The Padraig Pearses Fundraising CommitteeRead more

title: support casey mihails fight for soccer justice
Description: Hello,My name is Robert Varga and my daughter was looking forward with much enthusiasm to finally get a chance to play for one of the best and most accomplished soccer coaches in Canada - Mr. Casey Downey.  Here's why I used the word "was" instead of "is" and why we are asking for your support both financially and in the form of character statements at this crucial time.Casey spent a total of 44 years with one soccer club both as a player, and as a coach for the past 31 years.  In his time as a coach, Casey found his niche in the girls aged U15-17 teams. He invested countless hours, enthusiastically and passionately developing and preparing the players for Canadian and U.S. university soccer along with winning many prestigious championships along the way.  Casey is very proud of the fact that he has helped send over 100 girls on to the next level and there are many players and families who are eternally grateful for what Casey brought to both the pitch and their scholarship journey.  Additionally, his efforts and commitment definitely do not end on the field as he remains in constant contact with players well after his years as their coach. Surprisingly and disappointingly, it was confirmed to Casey this past September that there were "no (coaching) vacancies" at the club he dedicated so much of his life to and where he had so much success. It was always his intention to retire from this club in good standing. After numerous conversations with the club to try and make something work but to no avail, and with no offer for a team or program to coach within his desired age groups, Casey understandably decided to move on. He wanted to keep his successful program alive to help even more girls but knew that his talents were best served coaching the ages where he could assist with scholarships.  Ultimately, Casey chose to move to Mihail Markovic and his Burlington Force Soccer Academy where he was welcomed with enthusiasm. It's a perfect fit as Mihail and his Force Academy has been growing in popularity and player registrations every year and he was seeking a person to specifically fulfill his desire to offer girls a pathway to scholarships.  Shockingly and most unfortunately, when word got out, two clubs immediately filed unfounded complaints against Casey, Mihail and the Force Academy for player inducement and not following the proper procedure around coaching license transfers.  There simply was no evidence to speak of and the process around all of this was questionable, upsetting and confusing to say the least.  Let's just say, the pitch was not tilted in their favour from the get-go and it became painfully evident that several people and organizations felt threatened by his program and its potential impact on their clubs now that he wasn't working for one of them anymore.  In short, they were determined to see Casey's coaching career come to an end and stifle the growth of Mihail and the Force Academy.Those who know Casey know emphatically that he does not have to induce or entice anyone to play for him as his reputation has preceded him for many years now.  Players from all across Ontario regularly seek him out, just like our family did. The most unbelievable part of all this; the charges levied against Casey, Mihail and the Force Academy were an 8 year suspension for Casey and a $9,000 fine for the Academy.  Effectively, taking Casey out of coaching for good. The harshest possible penalties.As you would expect, when it became known, countless players, families and friends past and present were outraged and have subsequently reached out to both Casey, Mihail and the Force Academy in support, including our family.  The response has been overwhelming to say the least.  Not only were these charges unfounded and unprecedented, being the maximum that anyone has ever received, but Casey, Mihail and the Force Academy itself, along with those close to them, have suffered enormous stress, pain, embarrassment and their integrity and character have been unfairly and unjustly brought into question.  This is why we are fighting back, because it's just wrong - pure and simple.  All Casey and Mihail want to do is coach, develop, support and put the absolute best product on the pitch and help get girls to the university/college level, that's it.  It's innocent and well-intentioned.We are fighting for fairness and justice and raising funds for a legal defense for Casey, Mihail and the Force Academy to have these charges dropped in their entirety so Casey and Mihail can be free to do what they do best.  A volunteer committee of parents quickly stepped up to help and after much deliberation and counsel, decided that this was the best course of action to overturn this egregious and unfair decision.We have four asks of you:#1 Please donate what you can, any and every amount is appreciated and any and all surplus funds will be donated to the Canadian Tire JumpStart registered charity giving kids from families in financial need the chance to participate in sports - https://jumpstart.canadiantire.ca.#2 Please take the time to express how you feel about Casey, Mihail and/or the Force Academy as people, coaches, an organization and what impact they may have had on your soccer journey.#3 Please do not write anything disparaging about any club and/or individual Casey, Mihail or the Force Academy may have had interactions with.#4 Please share this with anyone you know who may want to support the cause and express how they feel about Casey, Mihail or the Force Academy.On behalf of Casey, Mihail and the Force Academy, we thank you in advance and we are eternally grateful for any support you can provide.  Thank you.Robert VargaRead more

title: univ of washington womens club baseball team
Description: Help send the first Women’s club baseball team at the University of Washington to their first college tournament in Los Angeles, California on March 19-22, 2022. This team was established because most girls were told that they could not play baseball and it’s only for boys. On a macro level, the Husky women are part of a nationwide movement aimed at increasing the opportunities for women to compete in baseball of the hardball variety. And it’s working. Buoyed by a nonprofit organization called Baseball For All, started by pioneering baseball player and coach Justine Siegal, baseball participation by girls and women across the country is booming. Please fund this ground breaking team. Read more

title: support carls speedskating dream
Description: Four years ago, as we drove to Milwaukee to watch the 2018 Long Track Olympic Trials at the Pettit National Ice Center (PNIC), Carl, 13, declared he wanted to qualify to compete at both the Short Track and Long Track Speed Skating Olympic Trials in 2022 -- a feat few other speedskaters have accomplished.To achieve that goal, he added spinning at Studio Spin and working with a personal trainer, Ryan Ribordy, to prepare him for weight training.  Of course, at that time, it was impossible to foresee the challenges we would face as a family and what life would look like in a world forever altered by the pandemic.The speedskating community is small, close-knit, and supportive of its athletes.  Even with the challenges our family faced, Carl was able to train with several programs -- Academy for Skating Excellence, Glen Ellyn, and Park Ridge -- and coaches who supported his desire to be competitive as both a Short Track and Long Track speedskater.  He skated for free or at a discount, and multiple families helped with transportation (at that point, Carl was training in Milwaukee, Hoffman Estates and Park Ridge).During the summer of 2020, as we emerged from lockdown, Carl entered a training bubble with skaters at the PNIC, which shifted the burden of transportation to me, as he was only allowed to travel with people he lived with.  Four to six days a week, I drove to Milwaukee and set up an “office” (read:  folding table, chair, laptop computer, extension cord and a personal air conditioning unit as it was brutally hot most days) outside the building.  I was only allowed to enter it to use the restroom. Carl trained with Hongyang Wang, who coached the Short Track program through the summer, and began training Long Track in the fall.  After several COVID-19 exposures which resulted in periods of quarantine and training disruptions for both the Short Track and Long Track program (because Carl was “crossing” from one “training bubble” to another), in October of 2020, Carl made the very difficult decision to stop training Long Track.  Everyone involved agreed he needed to pick one program to train with at that point.With no local racing opportunities, it was hard for Carl to measure his growth as a Short Track skater, but he felt he was improving based on his performance at practices.  As hard as it was to train in what felt almost like a vacuum, through it all, Carl was committed to his goals.  He trained with his Short Track athlete bubble, took outdoor spin classes (in all kinds of weather) and worked with his personal trainer when possible.In January of 2021, even though he hadn’t been training Long Track, Carl decided to compete at the Long Track Junior meet.  He had no expectations given his lack of training.  He finished 9th overall and came away from that meet believing his short-term goal of making the 2022 Long Track Junior World Team and his long-term goal of qualifying for the Long Track Olympic Trials were still attainable.In July of 2021, at Carl’s first Short Track meet since his season was cut short by the start of the pandemic in March of 2020, he skated the 1000 under 1:30, achieving the second-chance time standard to qualify for the Short Track Olympic Trials.  (The top 12 skaters in the U. S. after Am Cup I in Salt Lake City in September automatically qualified for Short Track Olympic Trials, with four additional skaters qualifying through a time-trial the day before the Short Track Olympic Trials.)In October of 2021, Carl resumed Long Track training after what was essentially a two-year hiatus.  He was working with Bob Corby, who came out of retirement to coach another junior skater.  At his very first Time Trial, Carl achieved an Olympic Trial time standard and -- dropping significant time at every Time Trial opportunity -- went on to achieve Olympic Trial time standards and International Skating Union (ISU) time standards in every distance but the 5000. In late October, one of Carl’s brand-new Long Track blades broke during practice.  A problem that would normally have been quickly resolved took on “pandemic” proportions and Carl faced three weeks of training disruption.  The issue with his broken blade was compounded by the fact that he was skating on very old boots never intended for Long Track skating (we think they were in-line boots at some point) and the fact that he did not own a Long Track skin.Unfortunately, Short Track Olympic Trials were held in Salt Lake City the same weekend as Long Track Junior Trials were held in Roseville, Minnesota, and Carl had to make the very difficult decision about where to race.  He raced at Long Track Juniors, where he finished 4th overall and was rostered to his first ever international skating team with U. S. Speedskating.  He was thrilled -- and was especially pleased that his second-place finish in the Mass Start, which pulls many of his most favorite elements of Short Track into the Long Track arena (and an event which has been described as a “bumper car derby on ice”) qualified him to race it internationally.  He will race the last two weekends in January in Innsbruck, Austria as part of U. S. Speedskating’s Junior World Team.Last weekend, Carl raced in the 500, 1000, 1500 and Mass Start at the Olympic Trials.  Spectators were not allowed, so we (and many, many supporters, for which we are thankful) watched most of Carl’s races on television.  He had sea-level personal bests in every distance, despite inadequate gear.  Curious?  You can watch him in the 1000 M race here:  https://www.loom.com/share/b1c0332513334bf994858143514dd484Carl had many wonderful experiences at Long Track Olympic Trials but came away disappointed not to have achieved a “funded time,” which is the time standard U. S. Speedskating requires Junior skaters to have for their travel to be paid for by U. S. Speedskating.  He anticipated being able to achieve that time this coming weekend during a Time Trial but learned last night that he will not be able to do so.To reduce the pressure Carl feels to perform (so he can focus on doing what he does best -- skating fast while loving what he does), I decided to start a GoFundMe campaign.  At this point, Carl’s trip to Austria is partially funded by family, but he had hoped to be able to use those funds to buy much-needed equipment (specifically new Long Track boots) and there are outstanding costs of the trip.  This campaign will fund the balance of the trip, the new Long Track boots he desperately needs and back-up blades which he will have to have next season.  Thank you, all.Read more

title: help hala kahiki fire recovery
Description: On December 30, 2022, Hala Kahiki Volleyball Club lost ALL their player uniforms, coaches apparel and team equipment when Sisters, Lena Quilantang and Liz Huyg's, family home in Superior was lost in the recent Marshall Fire. Liz, her two sons and Lena are 12 year residence of Superior who started Hala Kahiki Volleyball in 2019. Sadly, club competition was about to start with the first tournament scheduled for Jan 23, 2022. Uniforms and equipment were scheduled to be distributed when the fire broke out but everything was destroyed. Lena and Liz have been giving back within youth sports for decades across Colorado, California and Hawaii. This loss has been devastating for their family. It not only has a profound impact on them personally but the 50+ youth athletes and coaches (many also live in the Superior and Louisville area) who compete in club volleyball through Hala Kahiki VBC. Our goal is to raise enough funds to replace all uniforms, coaches apparel and team equipment lost in the Marshall Fire as soon as possible. Your support and donation would be greatly appreciated! In an effort to help support Lena, Liz, their family along with all the Hala Kahiki athletes and coaches; Flatirons VBC has offered to run this campaign on their behalf. Please consider donating so Lena and Liz can focus on their personal recovery and the day too day responsibilities that come along with running a youth volleyball club. Alice Crabtree-Haack, (Go Fund Me Organizer) represents Flatirons's Volleyball Club. All proceeds will go directly to Hala Kahiki Volleyball Club and their recover effort.Mahalo,Hala Kahiki Volleyball ClubFlatirons Volleyball ClubRead more
